scenes.location: LINCOLN TOWN CAR, (MOVING) IN A HARD RAIN-- MOVING
characters: CUT TO, EXT. MICK HALLER'S HOUSE
HARD CUT TO, EXT. STREET, BEVERLY HILLS, DAY
CUT TO, INT. DOORWAY TO REGGIE'S APARTMENT
/INTERCUT WITH, INT. D.A.'S OFFICE, MAGGIE'S DESK, SAME T
WE'RE IN A BAR, (MORGAN'S, STUDIO CITY)
CUT TO, INT. BACK SEAT, DETECTIVES' CAR, (MOVING)
CUT TO, INT. MARTHA RENTERIA' S APARTMENT
INT. VISITING AREA, COUNTY DETENTION CENTER, DAY
GO TO, INT. VAN NUYS JAIL, ATTORNEY/PRISONER ROOM
FADE IN, EXT. HAYLEY, CLIMBING A TREE
GET BACK FROM THE GLASS. OR THE
RAP BLASTING, EARL AT THE WHEEL...
SUDDEN CUT TO,, EXT. ON HAYLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRADUALLY FADE IN, under the SOUND of rain & freeway, DRIVER, black, 20s, low patter to which Mick barely liste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin', when Not-Guilty- Two gets to four thousand miles, that's two cars ready, that's enough to start the airport runs... (then, realizing) You gettin' any of this, Mr. Haller? Not this morning. Mick watches the rain without seeing it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your speed up, Earl. Earl kicks it, passes cars... Mick takes a FILE from a stack beside him. Also laptop, c phone rack: His back seat is his rolling office. Opens th file. Top sheet: THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA v. LOUIS ROULET. Tight on Mick. His eyes see back to the be innin CUT TO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town car sails along, bright glint off the surface streets-- We HEAR HARD RAP, TUPAC SHAKUR-- CELL PHONE RIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl-- buds. A command. Earl puts in earbuds, Rap cuts out. Into cell-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Haller.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE OVER CELL
dialogues.text: Where are you this morning?
This time Mick's in a mussed suit, surrounded by newspape open files, electric shaver, take-out coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way to Lancaster for a calendar call. Why, have you got something?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (VAL)
dialogues.text: I got a franchise player is what. Reaction Mick: He's heard it before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, this guy could be money. But he goes before the judge at eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Nuys by eleven could be hard--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this client, listen Mick, his mother's lawyer just waltzed in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already got a lawyer?--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strictly real-estate, doesn't know his ass about criminal. Will you listen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy waltzes in, ready to put up the family's beach house in Malibu against the million in bail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million? What'd they book him on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picked up a girl last night-- Whatever went down she ended up pretty bad. Cops want Aggravated Assault with G.B.I.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has the D.A. filed yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. See? I'm giving you ground floor. So make it work for me, Mick. Don't let him use the house, get him to go for my bond-- Meanwhile the Lincoln's approaching the Lancaster courtho there are cars, people-- a traffic jam. To Earl--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me around to the employee's gate, I'll talk my way in. (into cell, writes) I'm at the courthouse. Give me the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be Louis Roulet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-O-U-L-E-T, like the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how you spell the wheel but I got it, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember: I steered him to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on my Christmas list, Val. Lincoln swings abruptly to a steel gate. "EMPLOYEES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING with Mick through the press of lawyers, others, be the Judge shows up, as a few PRISONERS are led into the holding pen-- Mick picks out his client, HAROLD CASEY, 30 lanky, with a ponytail and skull & halo tattoo... Mic catching his eye but Harold's clearly avoiding him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold. Hard Case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hide from your lawyer, Harold, you know what I want to talk about. Caught, Harold slouches towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. when the judge comes in he's going to want to know if we're ready for trial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not and you know why not. You haven't paid me. Rule one, remember Rule one, Harold? I get paid or I don't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I have your money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, you have my money, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming. I talked to my boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold-- I looked at the list of people I trust, and you know what? You're not on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law says you can't just quit. The Judge won't let you. I looked it up. Mick's about to react to this jailhouse lawyering-- when hush falls, and the JUDGE comes out: ORTON POWELL, 60...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay close attention, Harold. Goes to his seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold's case has been called, Mick stands--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Haller for the defense, your honor. If I may, I'd like to carry this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a reason, Mr. Haller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having trouble locating a witness, your honor. An indispensable witness. A Mr. Green. With emphasis. A look goes between the Judge and Mick. Meantime Harold stares from the pen. The Judge, to Mick--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do you need? Would a week be enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so, your honor. As your honor knows, Mr. Green can be hard to track down. A look of understanding. Judge nods--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding this over pending notification from counsel... Then gavels down, for the next case-- As Casey's led off, Mick joins him along the rail-- He hisses--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was bullshit, askin' for a delay-- I know what that was about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so does Judge Powell. He spent a lot of years as a defense lawyer, so he knows all about having to chase "Mr. Green," and he doesn't look kindly on defendants who don't pay their attorneys. Now do you get it, Harold? Casey won't look him in the eye-- RAP MUSIC IN AGAIN, TUP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black town car cruises south, past dry brown hills... CELL PHONE RINGS AGAIN...

dialogues.speaker: BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Earl, unasked, puts in his buds, as Mick answers the call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Haller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a one-bedroom in Studio City, Lorna's 33, redhead, pretty as hell, works at her kitchen table in her bathrob among breakfast dishes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I'm in my office. On my way to court in Van Nuys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means Val reached you about his customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah: "This is the franchise, Mick." According to Valenzuela every case is "the franchise." I'd have paid my mortgage ten times over by now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be he's right. I ran the name, the family's got a real estate business in Beverly Hills. The Times has them down for some big house sales, movie-star dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like the media might be interested. Call Sticks, tell him to show up. Any other calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of DUI's, I quoted them the house number. That's it, you're free after Roulet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then I can go to County lock- up. Under which Mick sees Earl indicate something on the road while Lorna reacts to what Mick said, exasperated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to see Gloria. Why do you waste time on her, Mickey? Mick sees where Earl's pointing: SQUAD OF MOTORCYCLES, HARLEYS, IN THE SIDE-VIEW MIRRORS... They pull up alongsi gang jackets, black leather vests... Big guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to do somethin' about this? 'Cause I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore them, you're doing fine. FACE OF THE LEADER OF THE MOTORCYCLES, leers at Mick thro window, as Mick ignores, answers Lorna re "Gloria":

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say, Lorn, I've got a soft spot for redheads. Why do you think I married you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The divorce papers called it temporary insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for you there was a cure. When-- Earl interrupts, insistent now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller? Calling his attention to-- THE MOTORCYCLES HAVE PULLED IN FRONT. The leader signals Earl to pull off. Mick sees the surrounded. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln follows the Harleys off, PULLS TO A STOP in a at the crest of the exit. Jagged rocks, craggy peaks. The leader gets off his bike. EDDIE VOGEL, nearly 300 lbs Skull & halo patch on leather vest-- same as Harold's The "Road Saints." Mick lowers a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counsellor, how's it hanging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Eddie, how's it with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard Case called me from the pen, he said I might catch up to you. Said you're stalling his case til you see more green, is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want me to work you've gat to pay me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We paid you. Five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's long gone. I could tell you half went to the aerial-photo expert. He's going to blow the state's case by showing that the DEA violated the air space over Harold's farm by flying too low... but you don't need to know that. All you need to know is, we had a deal. Time to refill the tank. Eddie smiles. Taps the side of the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, gas-guzzler like this. I heard you got three more. What's one man need with four Lincolns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You want another five grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten. I'm flying the guy in from Kodak in New York, he wants business class...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want Harold back on the farm. He's the best farmer we got, if you know what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. And I don't want to. Either pay me my money or go with the Public Defender the judge finds you. Of course he won't know much about air space, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your shirt on, Counsellor. We want you. He reaches into a vest with his big hand. Thick envelope. Mick takes it. Starts to count, and realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had the whole ten ready. What if you'd backed me down to five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This vest got lots of pocket. Eddie taps another pocket and GRINS. one tooth missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVING ON: EIGHT MEN, prisoners in grey jumpers. S are black. Of the two white men, one's a wet-eyed, skanky JUNKIE, 40s. The OTHER is a tall young man, somehow polis even in prison outfit, definitely out of place here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis Roulet? LOUIS turns: the proverbial deer-in-the-headlights: Scare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Michael Haller. I had a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes-- Mr. Haller-- Mick stands behind a painted line three feet from the cel Signals Louis to come to the bars to talk. Louis approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- called you because I need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to represent you for your first appearance. I get twenty- five hundred for that. We can work out what comes next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you-- This is a set-up, Mr. Haller-- I made a mistake with that woman, she was setting me up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. And don't say anything about the case, not til I've got you out on bail. Okay? Mick's voice, as always, is easy and calm. Louis nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand your family lawyer's in court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. Cecil Dobbs. Points to-- DOBBS, balding dignified WASP, a few rows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he ready to post bail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll do whatever he has to. Mick nods, noting the tinge of desperation in Louis's voi Takes out a notebook...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, tell me about yourself. How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ties to the community? You grow up here, go to school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both. Beverly Hills, UCLA. I work for my mother's business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Windsor Estates?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's named for her second husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did you make last year? (when Louis hesitates) If I'm going to get you out I need to know everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My taxes last year said four hundred thousand. Just then, the White Junkie lurches forward towards Mick-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a lawyer too, you got a card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll have one for you out there. I need you to back up and leave us alone. Can you do that, pal? Junkie backs off, does just what Mick says. Impressing Lo Then Mick, low-voiced--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. They've put some heavy charges on you. The DA will probably ask for No-Bail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bail? Frightened voice, the others react, Mick hushes him, and.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said they're going to ask it. When was the last time you were arrested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I checked your record--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you'd find parking tickets. Mick looks briefly into the younger man's eyes-- he's sca fragile -- but sincere. He sputters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole thing is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not talking about the case, remember? Not even to the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I even say "Not guilty?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's about setting arraignment, period. You say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to get me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna try, Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing: There are lots of lawyers. Why pick me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.. remembered your name from some case in the papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drug case, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember the name or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- but you got the evidence thrown out against some guy-- Does it matter? (when Mick hesitates) I need your help, Mr. Haller. Off Mick, GO TO, AN 8 X 10 PHOTO OF A WOMAN'S BEATEN-UP FACE. CLOSE. Right eye bruised, swollen shut. Nose broken. Bloody gauz protrudes from her nostril. Lip cut and swollen like a pl Gash over the right eye. Fear in her expression... Studying it is ASSISTANT D.A. MAGGIE McPHERSON, 30s. We'r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's in a navy suit, raven-black hair: smart and stro and a beauty. Coming up behind her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the prosecutor who used to have the Roulet case? She starts to smile-- until his emphasis registers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me. Son of a bitch, Haller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules are rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright I'll go quietly. But after today's hearing, if you don't object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. You going for no-bail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't change with the prosecutor. Not with what your guy did. With which she shows him the photo: gruesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. "If." They only picked him up in her home with blood all over him, but it's a valid question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it when you're sarcastic. Can I at least see the arrest report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it from whoever takes over. No favors on this one.
Mick looks admiringly at Maggie. At her passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Hayley? A beat. Off the sudden shift in topic, Maggie starts putt away the things on her desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good. She likes the things you send her but would rather you show up yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this weekend? This takes her by surprise. But she takes him up on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll tell Hayley. Tonight. Only Mick-- don't cancel on her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. COURTROOM
dialogues.text: A TV CAMERA is trained toward LOUIS in the HOLDING AREA, tries avoiding it... while MICK AND MAGGIE are ARGUING IN FRONT OF THE JUDGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge, there is no way the state can claim my client is a flight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With resources like this man has, it's always a risk-- let alone the fact that the victim was brutally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. McPherson, the extent of her injuries are not the point. I'm setting bail at a million dollars... Mick wins, Maggie loses. Exchange glances--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick bangs out, always moving. Getting the door for him i his friend, bail bondsman "VAL" VALENZUELA, excited--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I tell you, Mick, we got us a franchise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see, Val...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the lawyer-guy, you get him to go for the cash-bond... MOVING from Val, Mick HEADS DOWN THE HALL, through the BU CRUSH of attorneys, clients, spectators to-- DOBBS, waiti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cecil Dobbs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller. (They shake hands.) It was depressing to see the boy caught up in that cattle call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've represented the family so long I think of Louis that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did look a little frail. My advice is, let Mr. Valenzuela fix you up with a bond and take "the boy" home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bond? But Mrs. Windsor was thinking of putting up property...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good. Assessing it will take days. By then Louis might be carrying somebody's child. (before Dobbs can argue) So just tap Val for the bond, spring Louis, and take him to your office. We'll meet there at Four. And heads off again. Dobbs follows him out, to... 0

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VAN NUYS COURTHOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: Sunlight. Where Dobbs suddenly TENSES as he SEES: A TV CAMERAMAN coming out with camera. Off Dobbs's reaction-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Media's already picked us up. DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Windsor's sensitive about the press... Mick, a beat. Then calls the cameraman over. When he come MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you in there filming. What's your name? CAMERAMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob Gillen. They call me "Sticks." MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You freelancing on this, Sticks? STICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your client's got profile, I figure I can sell it to local news. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? STICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much will they pay you for what you shot today? STICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends. Seven, seven-fifty. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose we take it off your hands for eight. Sticks hesitates, like it's not the legit thing to do. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or do we make it a thousand.
Sticks hesitates no longer. Takes the tape from the camer and hands it to Mick... who's already counting out money the roll of cash Ted gave him. To Dobbs-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can expense this, right? DOS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Absolutely. Sticks takes the money, goes. Dobbs, impressed, beaming n DOBBS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll admit, Mr. Haller, you weren't my choice. You were Louis's. Frankly I'd never heard of you. But maybe I should have. Seems to me I've underestimated you. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's talk about my fees. (before Dobbs can reply) I'll need a hundred thousand up front. Working off five-fifty an hour, it'll come to another hundred thousand if we go to trial. That's estimating the trial at a week. Appeals, we start over. Mick's Lincoln pulls up smoothly to fetch him at the curb Mick, hand on the door-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it that's not a problem. Reaction Dobbs-- hesitates but has no choice. MICK GETS I we GLIMPSE THE LINCOLN'S LICENSE PLATE: NT GLTY 2-- CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORNA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go, Mickey? We get the case? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his cell) We've got it if we want it. I'd still like to know the state's case, what they've got on him...
LORNA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? 'Course we want the case... Mick says nothing. Gaze out the window. Then... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an hour til he's released. Til then I'll be at county. With Gloria. (before she says anything) Any calls? LORNA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Sticks. He says he owes you five hundred next time he sees you. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah he does.

dialogues.speaker: INT. VISITING AREA, COUNTY DETENTION CENTER, DAY
dialogues.text: GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Mantle. You're going to bat for me again? GLORIA, redhead, 27 but good looks already fading-- greet the arriving Mick in a client/attorney booth. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know who the Mick was. You don't look good, Gloria. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. For coming, not for the compliment. Mick's already paging through her arrest-sheet, sees... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something new for you, getting booked on possession of coke, along with the usual. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb, I know. A guy paid me with it, I had it on me when I went to my next. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your next was a cop.
She shrugs/nods. Mick keeps turning pages, looking for a break... while... GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you get me into one of those rehab places where they get you straight? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did a pre-trial rehab, last time. The D.A. won't go for it again. You may have to do some jail here. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you can. They've got programs in jail, too. Look, you've had a long run. Maybe after this you can finally get out of the life. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do what? Have kids and plant flowers? Look at me. Mick doesn't have an answer. Opens a notebook, gets to wo MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, tell me what happened. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a guy at the Travel Lodge on Santa Monica... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who paid you coke instead of money? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a shitload in there. I saw. Which gets Mick's attention. His wheels suddenly turning. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who he was? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He reached me on my website. He was Mexican or something.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writes, likes this--) Did you screen him? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I screen 'em all? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: off what, his driver's license? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, his passport. I think his name was, Hector, or-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector what? Last name. Think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moya. Hector "Arrande" Moya is what you get if you run a trace. He's Colombian, a fugitive from a Grand Jury indictment down in Florida. The DEA wants him for drug trafficking. The D.A.'s LESLIE FAIRE: a woman, well-dressed, humorless MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie? They want him a lot. LESLIE FAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your girl's looking to trade? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll give you his motel and room number. LESLIE FAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll also have to testify on the coke. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a No. Location only. Your guys take it from there. My investigator says Hector hasn't checked out yet. LESLIE FAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she weighs it) What's she want in exchange?
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drop charges, and all she does is a Pre-trial Rehabilitation. The facility at USC-Med would be nice. (when she hesitates) Or do I take this straight to the Feds? Which, though veiled, is a threat. Leslie hates this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH FLOOR, TALL WINDOWS. DOBBS, ON THE CUT, lets in MICK Mick's checking the impressive room, vast views all the w to the Pacific, as the OTHERS enter behind him: MARY WIND (distinguished, 60), LOUIS (suit, silk t-shirt, Ray-bans. Another man, 45, thickly built, enters at Mick's side. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Windsor, this is Raul Levin. Mr. Levin's my investigator. Accepting this, everyone takes their place at the long, blonde-wood conference table. Mick can't help run his han over the surface, everything's a contrast to his own on-t fly office... Dobbs, to Mrs. Windsor... DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Windsor, I can't commend Mr. Haller highly enough for his performance in court this morning. Mary Windsor nods, provisionally pleased. MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a check for you, Mr. Haller. And slides it towards him in an envelope. Mick, tries not seem too much in a hurry as he glances inside-- ANGLE, we glimpse the amount, the zeroes... $100,000... B MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need that to come from your son, Mrs. Windsor. (slides it back to her) You can give him the money so he can write the check. But I want the check to come from Louis. He's my client and that's got to be clear from the start. No offense.
She is offended-- but takes back the envelope, nods to LO He takes out a checkbook, writes. Mick continues to Mary- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'll expect you to support your son through this in other ways. If you're willing. MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. I'll back my son come hell or high water. These ridiculous charges. That ridiculous woman. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to know you'll be there when we need you. MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not now, is that it? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be going over the case. The D.A. could make you testify about what you hear. Attorney privilege doesn't cover you. Mary Windsor's motionless a moment. Rather than respond, simply rises. To Louis-- MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see you at dinner. And goes. Dobbs gets the door for her. When she's gone: LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother built a good business. From the ground up. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no trouble believing that. (after a beat) I say we get started. All agree, they sit, Mick starts up-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first choice is whether we waive our right to a speedy trial. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want this behind me.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? You can stretch things out, enjoy your freedom. Most clients... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty clients, you mean. I want this over. Mick's struck by how firm. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We go to trial right away. Puts more pressure on the D.A. DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe the case never even goes to trial. (They look at him.) Our firm's clout is considerable. Pressure can be brought to bear--

dialogues.speaker: MI C K
dialogues.text: Don't kid yourself, Cecil. (to Dobbs and Louis) No way the state is dropping these charges. In fact, they've already upped them-- to improve their negotiating position. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be any negotiating. (before Mick can speak) No plea bargain, no nothing. I'm not going to jail for something I didn't do. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might not be jail. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if I walk. I'm innocent and if there's a trial I want to get on the stand and tell the jury I'm innocent. If that's a problem we can part company right now. Mick looks at the young man. Evaluating. Then... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to tell me what happened. Louis. Removes his Ray-Bans. SUDDENLY:

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE IN A BAR, (MORGAN'S, STUDIO CITY)
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES among L.A. yuppies, night-players. The scene low-key but sexy, expensive... Waitresses roam...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was having a drink at Morgan's, Ventura Boulevard...

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Morgan's, that's a singles bar, right? Camera finds LOUIS at the bar, checking out the action...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Right, nice place, good for pick- ups. That's why I was there. Looking to get laid, pure and simple.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO, LAW OFFICE
dialogues.text: Mick, to Raul, who's holding a dark blue file: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul, what's the file say about the girl? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads-- Chicago accent) Regina Campo, goes by "Reggie." Twenty six. An actress and a telephone solicitor. DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hoping to retire. Soon as she sues my client. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores Dobbs; to Louis) Did you know her before last night? BACK TO, MORGAN'S, NIGHT... HAND-HELD, CLOSE ON... REGGIE CAMPO, mid-20s, the finest sexual kitten imaginabl humor enlivening her face and eyes and mouth, moving...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'd seen her around, but never spoke to her. She was always with a guy. She was with one last night. She slows as she passes Louis, whispers, her lips brush h face as she discreetly hands him something... LOUIS (V. O.) (con t' d) She just laid her address on me. On a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But she was still with a guy? Reggie returns to: THE GUY at the bar: 40s, hard like a v

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I got it that she wasn't too into her date. She told me he'd be gone by ten if I was interested.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO, LAW OFFICE
dialogues.text: LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't keep the napkin. I work in real estate, I remember addresses. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul. Check that file you've got and see if the Police report has any of this. While Raul looks, Mick explains to Louis and Dobbs, can't hide some professional pride in Raul Levin's work-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul's already worked us a little miracle. He's managed to score a copy of the discovery file, everything the D.A.'s got. They'd have to turn it over eventually but it could have been weeks. Under which, Raul's checked the blue file, and... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. They don't have the other guy. They don't even have the bar. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All they've got is, Louis shows up and beats the crap out of her?
RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is such bullshit-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep telling me. EXT. PARKING LOT, REGGIE'S APARTMENT COMPLEX... NIGHT... LOUIS is sitting in a Porsche Carrera...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I didn't want to walk in on anything, so I got there early. His POV, shadow-figure of Hard-Guy approaching in the dar LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited til the guy came out.

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You see what he was driving?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A Corvette. Yellow. Hard-Guy gets in the Corvette, pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So he leaves, and you go in... INT. HALLWAY/ DOOR TO REGGIE'S APARTMENT... HAND-HELD... Arriving up the stairs is Louis, knocks. A little while, the door opens a crack. Reggie, part of her face, peers o

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She saw it was me... CONTINUOUS AS LOUIS ENTERS HER APARTMENT... LOUIS (V. O.) (coast' d) The hallway inside was tight. I had to walk past her, y'know, so she could close the door. So I had to turn my back to her. We SEE this, she's behind him... as we hear, simply...
LOUIS (V.0.) (cont'd) Then, that was it. BACK SUDDENLY TO, LAW OFFICE. MICK, SURPRISED. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was what? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hit me with something and I went down. It got black fast. SUDDEN POP TO, LOUIS STRUCK FROM BEHIND... Blacking out a tumbles... BACK TO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conference table's silent. All looking at Louis. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then. What do you remember next? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waking up with two guys sitting on me. Holding me down. QUICK CUT TO, REGGIE'S APARTMENT, LIVING ROOM... TWO GUYS straddle Louis who is face down on the floor. LOUIS (V.0.) (cont'd) Couple of faggots from next door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO, LAW OFFICE
dialogues.text: RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police report has them, homosexual couple from down the hall... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said. Faggots. To which Raul says nothing. After a beat-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Louis. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was still foggy when the cops came...

BACK TO, LIVING ROOM... Louis is cuffed by now, hands beh him, COP looms over... LOUIS (V.O.) (cont'd) She was on the couch telling all these lies... PARAMEDICS work on Reggie's bloodied face while, to a FEM COP (MAXWELL), through sobs, still frightened-- REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .he was like an animal! He said he'd rape me and kill me... then rape me again when I was dead... Louis looks around at his left hand in a plastic ba Blood

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's when I saw she'd set it up. BACK TO, LAW OFFICE. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set it up how? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put blood on my hand. My left hand. But I'm right-handed, I'd use my right if I was going to... punch someone. Which is crazy. Louis mimes throwing a punch, in the air. Inept. DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis never hit anyone in his life. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she did made sense. It's the right side of her face that was hit, she had to bloody your left. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis: You said she opened the door a crack. Did you see her face? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all of it... CUT TO, DOOR OF REGGIE'S APARTMENT... OPENING AGAIN... It open a crack. Enough for her look out, half her face..
LOUIS (V.0.) (cont'd) Mainly her eye. Her left eye.

dialogues.speaker: RAUL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's it!... BACK TO, LAW OFFICE. Raul... mimes the opening of the doo RAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She already had the injuries, on the right. She was hiding it from him when he steps in... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she clocks him? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So our case is, she beat herself up? Mick takes the file, takes the 8xl0s, REGGIE'S PULPED FAC MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're saying, she pounded her face into hamburger meat, or had her boyfriend do it, hoping some far- off day a jury would give her a big fat reward? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have. DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. She saw his Porsche, his Rolex, it's known the family has money... I'll wager she's already filed in civil court. Mick. Thinks. Then, to Raul-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the police report. Let's hear how Reggie tells it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. DOORWAY TO REGGIE'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: She's opened a crack, peering out... Raul reads...

dialogues.speaker: RAUL, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: "According to the victim, she was at home alone when the suspect presented himself at the door as someone she knew..." Louis is there, talks MOS. Reggie opens the rest of the w RAUL (V.0.) (cont'd) "Upon letting him in, she was immediately struck..." WHICH WE SEE: The vicious repeated pounding of her face, bloodying her, but it's too fast & jumbled for detail

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Does it say he knocked her down? She falls... Louis flies down on top of her...

dialogues.speaker: RAUL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, then straddled her. "Held the victim by the neck until she agreed to cooperate..." Louis does as described, strangle-hold... Eventually lets up, turning her toward the bedroom. And... RAUL (V.O.) (cont'd) "The suspect maintained a position behind her, holding a knife against the left side of her throat..." CLOSE, HAND-HELD, KNIFE-POINT TO NECK, SLIGHT CUT, BLOOD. RESUME, INT. LAW OFFICE. Raul takes something new from the file: PHOTO OF A BLOODY KNIFE. Sharpened to a point. Louis looks at it. Seethes. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't my knife. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul, are his prints on there? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the report says. I'm not surprised, if she put blood on his hands she's gonna put prints on his knife...
LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, it's not "my" knife! Mick ignores, still intent on Raul's reading... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how's she say he went down? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "As Ms. Campo entered the hallway, she pushed the intruder backwards into a large floor vase..." GO TO, INT. REGGIE'S APARTMENT - LOUIS FALLING... And Reggie scurrying free... STAY ON the fallen Louis as.

dialogues.speaker: RAUL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Realizing her attacker would catch her at the front door, she ducked into the kitchen and seized a bottle of vodka..." Louis, struggling to his feet, HIT ON THE HEAD from behin

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V. D.)
dialogues.text: And clonked him when he got up?

dialogues.speaker: RAUL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's how she tells it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are all lies, this is bull-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everything she said is a lie, this will be the easiest case ever. I'll tear her apart and throw her entrails into the sea. But Louis... (He moves closer, for:) You swear it's all lies? Is there anything you aren't telling me? Mick's eyes burn into him. Louis answers simply. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Mick holds him in a long, hard, assessing stare. Over whi eventually, we PRE-LAP--

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The way Louis tells it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .it's just quirky enough. Mick and Raul coming out, after having a few. It's a lawy hangout at this hour, others are coming/going... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quirky enough for what? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be true. Maybe it went down just like he says. (off Raul's look) Anyway there's a. chance. In a party of law-types, we GLIMPSE MAGGIE, who catches s of Mick in the doorway... while Raul mulls what Mick said RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An innocent client. Jeezus. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But you know what my father said about innocent clients... Maggie's overheard this, gives the answer. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said there's no client as scary as an innocent man. Mick, seeing her, smiles and continues, a little tipsy... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Because if you screw up and he goes to prison, it scars you for life. There's only one verdict. You've got to put an N.G. on the board. (ADDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mags. She reads the state he's in.
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul, if you let a man drive in his condition I think I can charge you both. The guys look at each other. Maggie swipes the keys-- MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive him to his house. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how will you get home? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends brought me. I'll keep the car, he can pick it up at my place in the morning. (TO MICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. And she gets in the driver's side, waits. Mick to Raul-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you know the moves. Make the rounds, check out Morgan's Bar... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mr. Corvette... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Regina Campo. The way Louis says she came on's got me wondering. Mick gets in and closes the door. As Maggie starts it up pulls away, and we SEE the "NT GLTY" PLATES again... go t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride in silence. Then Mick, mischievous, turns on the RAP TUPAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "God bless the dead and buried nigga, Don't worry if you see God first, Tell him shit got worse..." MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding me. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl lays this stuff on me.
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Earl tonight? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never keep him this late. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't he worked your fee off yet? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while ago. But he likes driving, keeps him out of trouble... He's taking courses, too, in music. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell by this stuff. She snaps the rap OFF. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get used to it. Besides, Tupac, he helps me understand my clients. Most of them go to school on his LYRICS-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Roulet. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Louis, no. Louis is my franchise player, he pays for all the rest... After a beat... Office gossip... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard Smithson assigned Ted Minton to your case. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's brand new. Bright, though. Smithson's protegee. Naturally. Georgetown, buys his suits at Brooks, above all he's a guy... Mick looks over at her, as she flares, calms... Moonlight lines her profile. Made self-conscious by his watching he she moves her hair from her face. Beyond pretty: Beautifu
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorna made me my schedule. Saturday's fine to take Hayley. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday there's the Sponge-Bob movie... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all over it. How's she doing? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll know when I drop you and get home to relieve the sitter... (catches him looking) What? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight becomes you. MAGGIE (GLANCES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not doing me any good, Haller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln pulls up. Mick gets out but stands there. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She nods You're welcome. And pulls away. Mick's smile fad as he looks up at his dark lonely house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANSWERING MACHINE, he's just hit Play. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF A CHILD, (HAYLEY)
dialogues.text: Daddy, Mommy said I could call and say G'night. Sorry you're not there. G'night, Daddy. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, baby. Then Mick hits "Play" again. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF HAYLEY
dialogues.text: Daddy, Mommy said I could call...
Off a FRAMED PHOTO: HAYLEY, B, curls, Irish eyes...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LATER
dialogues.text: Mick's got a drink in his hand. Below: L.A. is spread out Wide, white scattering of lights. Above: Stars.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE FLYNN, 60
dialogues.text: (put-on Irish brogue) Top o' the mornin', Mr. McGinley! You know what day it is? Mick's client, DARIUS McGINLEY, black, 2B: In chains. Mic beside him, as he answers, confused-- DARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day I get my sentence? JUDGE FLYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That too. But it's also St. Patrick's Day. A day to revel in your Irish heritage. Darius doesn't get Flynn's joke. Mick cautions Darius, lo MI CK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an asshole but just be cool. Darius scowls... under which Mick notices that RAUL has showed up, is trying to get his attention... while... JUDGE FLYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the origin of your name, Mr. McGinley? DARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slave-holder, I 'spect. Why do I care who that motherfucka be? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius I told you-- DARIUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's dissin' me! JUDGE FLYNN (GLARES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright: If you don't care about your name, then I don't. (MORE)

JUDGE FLYNN (cont'd) Let's get on with your sentence for the sale of rock cocaine and get you off to prison, shall we? Darius, pissed. Raul waves to Mick, wants to talk... INT. COMPTON COURTROOM - LATER - ANGLE... Darius led off by guards-- Mick, defeated, confronts Raul MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What couldn't wait, Raul? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightens a little) Wanna see a movie? CUT TO, FULL SCREEN: B&W VIDEO PLAYS, SHOWS: MORGAN'S FIXED DOWNWARD ANGLE on the bar, near the cash register. Tending bar, two hot young women, jeans, white t-shirts.. FRAME-COUNTER ticks off, bottom right: 8:11 P.M., MARCH 6 RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We caught a break. The owner had a camera installed to watch his register after he caught the help dipping in last year... MICK'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here comes Louis. Said as LOUIS enters frame, sits. MOS, orders a drink. We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Earl stands outside the car, as if on guard. . .Rau points out the action, working the keys... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the tape transferred to disc, so I could manipulate, y'know... Raul starts to ZOOM... Shows Mick, on the SCREEN... RAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to meet Reggie Campo.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN VIDEO IMAGE AGAIN
dialogues.text: ZOOMING IN on REGGIE AND HER GUY, over drinks... FREEZES. RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mr. X. The Corvette-man. MICK'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't have popped a grand for the tape if I wasn't. Now watch... STARTS PLAYING IMAGE AGAIN, widen to full shot. RAUL'S VOICE (cont'd) Nothing for like a half-hour... He RACES THE TAPE FORWARD... Time code FLIES... He slows as it reaches 8:40, 41, 42...43. RAUL'S VOICE (cont'd) Then... Here. Mr. X gets up, with pack of cigarettes, goes... MICK'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the place. They got a smoking porch out front. RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where he goese. Giving Reggie her chance. Watch her. She passes behind Louis, trails her hand along his shoulders... keeps going out of frame...

dialogues.speaker: MICI
dialogues.text: That's not how he said it went down. He said she gave him her address, on a napkin... RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, wait, she just went to the little girls'. But she's gotta come back, no? And NOW HE FAST-FORWARDS TAPE AGAIN... And this time she stops by Louis, speaks into his ear, presses her body aga him... Louis nods, takes something from her... Reggie kis his cheek quickly, continues on... Rejoins X at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BACK SEAT, LINCOLN, DAY
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes it in, excited) Do the cops have this? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can they? I got the one and only. It ain't a copy. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're exceedingly beautiful. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. (speeds the tape again) .Reggie and X decide to split...

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO IMAGE AGAIN
dialogues.text: Guy takes a final swig, finishing drink... they exit fram RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out his hand, his watch. MICK'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on his left. That's no good...

dialogues.speaker: INT. BACK SEAT, LINCOLN, DAY
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means he's right-handed. But the facial blows were from the left... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down. You said you knew Morgan's. So you oughta realize... (as Mick stares) This image is in the mirror over the bar. That's how the owner set the camera to watch his register. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everything's backwards... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And X punches with his left.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you you were beautiful. Anything else? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But it's not on the tape. You know how you were wondering about Regina? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Raul just looks at him. Off Mick,

dialogues.speaker: HARD CUT TO, EXT. STREET, BEVERLY HILLS, DAY
dialogues.text: Jams/wedges its way through traffic, to halt at the curb. MICK exits, heads towards... into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the reception desk is ROBIN, tan/sexy blonde, hair hanging straight over one eye like a scythe... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Haller. Here to see Louis. ROBIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Roulet is with someone. He can't be disturbed. It's like he doesn't hear her-- walks calmly past her-- t THE DOOR TO LOUIS ROULET'S OFFICE- Mick ENTERS, finds Lou with his loafers off, on the couch with his cell-phone cradled to his ear. Robin chases behind... ROBIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Roulet, this man just came back here-- LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Robin. You can go. Robin exits. Louis mutters an apology into his cell-phone rings off. Looks annoyed at Mick. LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was setting up a showing.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be any showings in Pelican Bay. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a supermax prison where they send violent sex offenders. You'll fit in real good in your loafers. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me, Louis. I'm about to go and see the new prosecutor, who's doing everything he can to put you away, and now I find out you've been lying. (before Louis can deny) Tell me about Reggie Campo. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her? I've told you-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me. That you were going to pay her for sex. (off Louis's surprise) You think it's hard to find out somebody's not Snow White? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright yes, I was going to pay. She wrote down a price on the napkin, four hundred dollars... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me this in Cecil's office? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want my mother to know. Cecil tells her everything. And can we keep it down? Her office is on the other side of that door... Mick looks at Louis's concern. Believes it. Easing up...
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This changes things. You see that, don't you? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a lawyer. Explain it to me. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright I will. You know that guy on the Venice boardwalk? The one who has all those plates spinning on sticks? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this have to do with-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen. A bunch of spinning plates: that's the state's case. In the middle is a big one. It's a fucking platter. And if that falls it takes the others down with it. (He gets closer to Louis) The big plate is the victim. The only witness against you. I knock her down, the act is over and the crowd goes home. No trial. Mick has Louis' attention now. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make this trial go away? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost time. You concealed from me the fact that could do it. It comes down to why. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why what? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would a guy with a Porsche and a Rolex need a knife to get sex from a woman who sells it anyway? The answer is, he wouldn't. And when you see that you see the set- up, the trap. And suddenly it's the defendant who looks like the victim. Louis gets it. Penitent.
LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to the prosecutor now? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Young hot-shot named Ted Minton. He wants to give me the discovery file. Poor guy doesn't know that Raul already got it. He's new to felonies but he's no dope. When he hears his vic's a hooker he'll know we've knocked all his plates down. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it'll be over? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No promises, Louis. Louis closes his eyes, savors the prospect. Then sees Mic the door. When he opens it: MARY WINDSOR's there. Surpris to see Haller.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WINDSOR
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were here. Is there news? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be, Mother. And puts out a hand to Mick. Grateful. Hesitating half a beat, Mick shakes it and goes... Louis and his Mother. Regard each other. Face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick in a chair. Impatient. Legal secretaries, prosecutor etc., come and go, when-- a guy Mick recognizes, DETECTIV KURLEN, fat, 40, approaches a desk with a stack of papers SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these for A.D.A. Knight? KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and they're my only copies. I'll wait while you copy them. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to ask her... But, he holds them back. Stares. She yields...
SECRETARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll run them for you now. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I wanted to hear. She goes. Mick tries to avoid Kurlen-- but too late-- KURLEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look who's come callin'. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Kurlen. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re papers he dropped off) Puttin' a case away. Guy drowned his neighbor's kid in a tub to see what it felt like. It won't shock you to hear he was high... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for clearing that up. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he gets San Quentin, maybe he can look up your boy Jesus Martinez. Mick bristles at this reference. Turns away again. To a PASSING SECRETARY: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a passing secretary) Is Minton back yet?-- SECRETARY #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be a few more minutes, sir. Kurlen, seeing he's drawn blood, continues to needle. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doin' up there, anyway? He make the pucker-up-and-kiss-me team? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't talked to him. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess once they plead guilty, they're not much use to you. (MORE)
KURLEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing it in) He went down forever, right? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got life, but he'll be out. I don't know when. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. 'Cause his victim, Martha Renteria? She's dead forever. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to remind me you were lead dick on that. Kurlen grins. Shakes his head. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's a guy like you sleep at night? With the scum you represent. Mick's had enough. Moves closer. To tell him a story. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a client once, he decapitated his ex-wife, then kept her head in the refrigerator. KURLEN (DISGUSTED--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally you got him off. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The D.A. got greedy. Tried to pile on two unsolved murders, trick up evidence to stick my guy with them. It's called the justice system, we don't do things that way.

dialogues.speaker: KURT. EN
dialogues.text: So your guy's out walkin' around. He ever do it again? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I never heard of him after that. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he could have. Fuck you, Haller. MICK (THE POINT:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Fuck the D.A.
Before Kurlen can react-- TED MINTON arrives. Fresh-faced Ivy League, 30. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller? (Mick stands, relieved.) Sorry you had to wait. I hope it'll be worth your while. He gives Mick a thin, white-covered file from a briefcase Mick, leaving the still-sneering Kurlen behind, takes the file and follows Minton off-- tapping the file with a fin MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks kinda thin for a discovery FILE-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes well-- We can go to my office-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a question first. He takes from his pocket: Raul's DISC. The DVD Raul gave MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something to play this on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE the young prosecutor's face as he watches the bar-t And Mick watching him for his reaction... When it's done, Ted clicks it OFF. Not much reaction at a TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else do you have? The simple, polite question throws Mick. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Ted, let's cut the bullshit. Not only is your so-called victim a working prostitute, but we've got her on tape soliciting my client! Maybe you're new, but you gotta know how hard it's gonna be to convince a jury a guy would have to rape a hooker to have sex with her--
TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you're telling me's going to change my offer. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Offer? You're making an offer? going forward? Not the way Mick thought it would go. Ted goes on... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll drop the charges to Assault with a Deadly and Attempted Sexual Battery. The guidelines put him at seven years, maybe he'll do four. Mick, uncertain now, doubts himself for the first time... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .What am I missing here?... Ted stays innocent-looking. Blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK with his daughter, HAYLEY, 8. Mick's ON A BENCH near where Hayley waits on line for the next pony... EARL approaches from the refreshment stand with an ice-cr for Hayley and one for himself. Kids playing everywhere, MINIATURE TRAIN chugs past... but Mick's lost in thought, beat-up briefcase open, he's working. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you the good stuff, Hayley... HAYLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Earl. Just then a little girl gets off a pony. The attendant ho it for Hayley. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man's got your ride ready... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, I'll hold your ice cream. Excited, Hayley goes. The attendant lifts her up and on, The pony carrying Hayley joins the others in the wide rin Mick watches her for a moment, waves-- then, balancing th ice cream, returns to his files--
MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something right in front of me and I'm not seeing it. On his lap he's spread out: PAGES from the TWO FILES: the blue-covered one Raul gave him. The white-covered from Te Mick starts turning pages, compares... The same, the same When he turns the next one over: It's the page Raul gave him showing the PICTURE OF A KNIF the picture we saw in Cecil Dobbs' office. Turns to the matching page from Ted's file. Reaction Mick

dialogues.speaker: HARD CUT TO, EXT. LINCOLN, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: In the parking lot, pulls up. Louis is in front of the cl golf-clothes, waiting. Comes out to meet the Lincoln...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we',re going to the movies! You promised me last week! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's got to talk to somebody. You stay with Earl. Mick gets out, Hayley stays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis hurries over, as far from the clubhouse as possible order not to be seen or heard-- eager-- LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened? Is it over? You said it would be over by now-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before I found out you were still lying to me. He shoves a sheet at Louis. Louis looks: PICTURE OF A KNI but DIFFERENT from the knife-picture we saw before.
MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that is? It's a picture of your knife. The one you had on you when you went to Reggie Campos. The one the cops have. Look at the blood on the blade. Look at the initials. Louis is stuck for an answer-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why Ted Minton didn't care when I told him Reggie's a prostitute. What's it matter, when he's got a knife with her blood and your initials on it? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't the knife in the file-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scowls, sore) That's right. The file Raul got us was a loaded deck. The cops must have been on to him, because they used it to set us up. So we'd think they had nothing, when in fact they had enough to put your Hugo Boss, golf-playing ass away for twenty years! Mick looks back towards the car, parked maybe 20 yards of He sees HAYLEY in the backseat looking out. So does Louis Mick sees him looking her way... Feeling the man's look, Hayley sits back. Out of sight. A moment... then Mick resumes. Cold and firm. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain to me why you lied about the knife. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lie. I said the one in the picture wasn't mine. Mick frowns/grins at the answer... LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said it twice! Nobody listened!
MICK (MOCKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you now, a lawyer? A clever, third-rate fucking lawyer with smart-ass technicalities? "You said it wasn't yours"-- What you should have said was, "I had a knife but this isn't it!" What did you think, it would just go away? (closing in on him) You brought a murder weapon to a meeting with a prostitute, Louis! How am I supposed to make that look like she set you up? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. Did. Not. Do this. Off which, Mick stares hard at Louis. At his frightened l Then tries-- slowly-- as if for the last time-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then kindly tell me why you went to her apartment with a custom-made knife, serrated tip, with "LR" engraved on the blade? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always carry it. For a moment, Mick takes this in. Echoes. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always carry it. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In real estate we show homes, to people we don't know. This one time... He stops. Like it's difficult. Then goes ahead... LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother. She was showing a place. It was in Bel-Air, so she thought it was okay to go alone, even though there was a man at the time who had raped some women that way. He was there. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was there?
LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man. He raped her. When she didn't come back, I went to the house and found her. Mick. Stirs. Like he's seeing a possibility... LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when she stopped showing property. I do the selling now. And I started carrying a knife. Always. Mick turns it over. Finally... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's quite a story, Louis. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother will have to testify. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want that. MICK (COLD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn what you think we want. From now on you do what I tell you while I try this case. Do I make myself clear? Louis is silent. Mick looks off. Towards Hayley, in the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE CUT she OPENS TO MICK CARRYING HAYLEY IN HIS ARMSi fast asleep but still clutching a carton of movie popcorn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie leads Mick-with-Hayley through, Hayley snuggles further in her father's arms. As they continue... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she wasn't so darn heavy I'd carry her all night, I swear. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defense lawyers will swear to anything...

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM, LATER
dialogues.text: He's at the door about to go. Maggie delays him with, MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're in a daze. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turned into a rough week. Being with Hayley was the only high. She can't find anything to say. As he heads out again... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's seen you at Four Green Fields lately. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped going. Too much of a scene. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well. If you start going again. Now she has his attention. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I start again, what? She's awkward. Smiles, shrugs to cover-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunch of us from the office are there. Tuesdays, after work. An invitation. S-zrprising him. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep it in mind. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. After more awkwardness, goes. She closes the door. CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noisy, drinking CROWD of legal types-- We're MOVING throu it-- Don't realize it at first but it's-- MICK'S POV-- he's trying to shoulder his way through towa A BOOTH OF WOMEN from Maggie's office-- Maggie sees him, lights up a little-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haller! Let him in, girls! Buy you a beer? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't make it to the bar... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's share this. They fight to a table for two, edge of the crowd. When he balks at sipping from her glass-- MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had a taste of each other before. He laughs a little, reads that she's had a few. He drinks MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling a little better tonight? Or did Ted Minton sandbag you? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (How'd she know?) Yeah, that's exactly what-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that guy Corliss, right? I told them using that dirtbag was a bullshit play. But you'll take the the guy's head off on the stand... Mick's off-guard, doesn't know what she's talking about. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catches herself, giggles) Whoops, I shouldn't say that... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to keep it alive) So Ted talked to you about Corliss?
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? It was me who sent him to Ted. Corliss thought it was my case because I handled first appearance. (sees Mick is too eager) I'm telling you too much. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, nothing I don't know, they always use a professional snitch... (when she doesn't bite) I mean Corliss has done this before, right? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clams up, with:) Can't we just forget work and have a friendly Guiness? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we go somewhere to eat? (before she objects) So we can talk about our daughter. MAGGIE (WEAKENS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell my friends I'm leaving. She goes. And Mick, quick, writes the name CORLISS on nap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you didn't know Sponge-Bob movies could be so much fun. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fun's watching her. Maggie likes this. Touch glasses. After a quiet moment... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know Minton had Corliss til I blabbed, did you. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was hiding something, I thought it might be a jailhouse snitch...
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me drunk to find out what you wanted to know. Except I was already drunk. Good point, right? He feels something. ANGLE, her hand on his knee... MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayley's probably asleep. I gotta go relieve the sitter-- (makes a face) Only I don't think I can drive myself home. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one good turn. I'll drive you. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And will you take me back to get my car in the morning? A loaded proposition. Covers her hand with his own. CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE HAYLEY, sleeping between her two parents. Mick open his eyes: Maggie's awake and staring at him. Grim. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not fair to her. (MICK STIRS--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waking up and finding you here. She'll get her hopes up. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd she get in here? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes in here when she has nightmares. She has nightmares. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she sleeps in here a lot? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start. You have no idea what it's like raising a child alone. He can tell by her tone: All last night's tenderness gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dressing-- she enters to him in a robe-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look-- I'll leave-- then come back in an hour. We'll go together to get your car then I can take her to SCHOOL-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that? You're gonna start taking her to school? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you remember what we talked about last night? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were just trying to get into my head on your case-- or get me into bed-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting angry now) I can't win with you-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when you're being a defense lawyer! Do you know how crazy we were to think we could ever make it? Me trying to get dirtbags off the street, you keeping them there-- MICK ALRIGHT MAGGIE-- MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unshaven. Edward Hopper drabness. To lose himself in work looks down at his files: An 8x10 OF REGGIE CAMPO'S BATTERED FACE. WAITRESS, 50s, pours coffee. Recoils as she glimpses the picture, the gruesome wounds, Mick didn't mean her to see
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. It's work. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope you catch the bastard who did it to her. And goes. Mick tucks the picture under some papers, to hi it-- but finds that he's only hid it halfway. Leaving hal her face exposed. The good half. Something about this... picks it up again, folds it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning over the sink, Mick holds the folded photo agains the mirror, the unhurt left side showing. Creates a full image of a face. He stares a long time. Then, to himself: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha Renteria.

dialogues.speaker: A WAREHOUSE-GARAGE DOOR RISING
dialogues.text: Mick, enters. THREE LINCOLNS LINED UP along a wall. Mick' "fleet." California plates: NT GLTY 1, NT GLTY 3, NT GLTY 4.. Walks past... to some battered file cabinets. He turn on a single-bulb lamp... DRAWER OPENING ON FILE CABINET... Mick's fingers fly thro the tabs of old files, stops at: MARTINEZ. Cut to, MARTINEZ FILES ON DESK, MOMENTS LATER: Mick exami them: Police reports, printouts. Until he finds... Autopsy report. Name: RENTERIA, MARIA. Takes out... Bx10 PHOTO: WOMAN DEAD ON A BED, NAKED. Dark bloodstains. NEXT PHOTO - TIGHTER: Knife-wounds. And bruises. NEXT PHOTO - HER FACE: BEATEN: Injuries to the left side (opposite of Reggie's.) Dark-haired, large brown eyes. MICK. Folds this one in half. Takes the folded shot of Reggie, fits them together, crease to crease: So alike, t form what could be the face of one woman. Mick. Not wanting to face the memory: a VOICE in his head MICK'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd called me before you talked to the cops, Jesus...
