dialogues.speaker: GO TO, INT. VAN NUYS JAIL, ATTORNEY/PRISONER ROOM
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK OF MICK WITH MARTINEZ, who's stalking around, i panic, while Mick is laying out the bad news... MARTINEZ (MEXICAN ACCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen my picture every place! They was gonna bring me in, so... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you told Kurlen you were in her apartment. He didn't have that, he doesn't even have any prints... MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit I tol' is true, man! I seen her at the Cobra Room, she said if I paid we could go to her place, she didn't care about the other guy... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody saw any "other guy"... MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was another guy, bpi guy that she was talking to... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus the coroner says her vagina was brutalized... MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you my lawyer or what, man? (insists, crazy now) When I left that chick was fine! I fucked her but I didn't hurt her-- You ain't even listenin'-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three people saw you throwing a knife into the L.A. River... MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I had that knife in my car! I knew they was gonna find it... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If all you did was fuck her then why didn't you leave any prints? The place was wiped down... (MORE)
MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your semen was on the towel, you forgot you wiped your penis on that towel... MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't forget nothing! I jus' used that towel, then I give the chick the money and I left! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna make. MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus they want the death penalty! I can see to it that never happens, but not if you don't plead. MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to say I did this? Mick hesitates but stays level. Unbending. No choice. MILK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, there's a deal to be made. I can do that. I can get you Life. (Martinez crumples...) Life means you'll do fifteen... MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm innocent! Inocente! You know what that means? Mick just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much traffic rolling out of the city, mid-morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick at the wheel. Beside him, his briefcase. SEES OUT ON WATER: the prison-fortress of SAN QUENTIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE CUT, JESUS MARTINEZ sits. 29, only a few years old than when we saw him but looks bad. Glass wall divide the
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to ask you how you are because I know. Martinez glares at him, then spits on the floor. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I need to ask some questions. MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you didn't have no questions then. Never ask, Did you kill that girl? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trying to make it right. Martinez is silent. Cold. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me again about the Cobra Room. MARTINEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. COBRA ROOM
dialogues.text: The black-light Latina club, music, smoke-- In the middle a pit iwith a BIG COBRA BASKET, out of which a girl in a snake costume emerges-- MARTHA. Watching is MARTINEZ-- MARTINEZ (V.0.) (cont'd) She was workin'. Dancin'. LATER, AFTER THE ACT-- Camera finds Renteria half-curling herself around MARTINEZ-- MARTINEZ (V.0.) (cont' d) Then she came and talked to me... She's whispering, Martinez is loving it-- MARTINEZ (V.0.) (cont'd) She tol' me I could take her home. I did, but I didn't kill her.

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You said there was another guy... Disentangling from Martinez, Martha slides toward a MAN, TALL, his back to us...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Si, she talk to him too, but she come back to me. Though she's with the other man, she glances back at Jesu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick opens his briefcase, takes out a stack of photos. On one holds them against the glass with his fingers... WHEN

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEW WILL BE TERMINATED.
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Mick complies-- but calls-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard! Long beat. Guard enters. Clean-Marine. Mick shows the sta MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need him to look at these. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't give him anything. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you won't let him close to the glass, how can he see them? GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my problem. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, but can you stay a minute? If he IDs one of these mug- shots I need you to witness it. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't drag me into your bullshit. And goes. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godammit. (then, to Martinez) Try. See if one is the guy. Mick holds up one after another. Martinez shakes his head Then the booking photo of Louis Roulet.
Mick holds it up. Off Jesus, as his eyes narrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRE-LAP the YELPING/SNARLING of a small /fierce dog... We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul in shorts, lets Mick in over the barks of his Shih-T RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool it, Ahab... C'mon in, Mick... Leaves Mick alone while he puts out the dog-- Mick cools his heels. Takes in: Cubs pennant, Raul's old peaked policeman's cap, mounted... finally pours himself vodka. Notes the photo of a YOUNGER GUY, its frame hung w the "Fight Aids" ribbon. Raul re-enters. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the drink) I helped myself. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I owe you, the way I let you down on that discovery file-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't you. The cops set you up. Who was it slipped you the file, anyway? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guy in vice I play cards with. Lonnie Fry. You don't know him. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, I don't. But I know who his partner was, when he was in homicide. Kurlen. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That prick. I'll make him sorry. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother. We've got bigger problems. The way Mick says it. Raul sits, asks--
RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? Where were you today anyway? You were hard to reach... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cell phones don't work too well where I was. Raul waits. Knows this is why Mick came here. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to tell you a story. About Jesus Martinez. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were at San Quentin. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about what happened after he left Martha Renteria's apartment. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he killed her? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never killed her. He went there, had sex, flushed the condom-- RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiped his prick on the pink towel-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then went home. The story starts after he left. RAUL (GETS IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real killer. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real killer. She lets him in.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. MARTHA RENTERIA' S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he fakes like it's still Martinez and he forgot something. Or maybe it was an appointment... We see the door open but we don't see who enters...

dialogues.speaker: RAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The other guy from the club? The one Jesus said he bid against?

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Right. He comes in, punches her a few times to soften her up... Renteria staggers as she's suddenly pummeled, then spun.. NICK (V.0.) (cont'd) Then takes out a knife and holds it to her neck while he walks her to the bedroom... We SEE the knife-tip against her throat... MICK (V.0.) (cont'd) Only she isn't lucky like Reggie Campo will be. He climbs on top, puts on a condom, rapes her... CUT TO, BEDROOM, as Mick gives us the action... MICK (V.0.) (cont'd) And when he's done he stabs her over and over, fifty-two times, while he works out something in his sick fucking mind. We SEE, the stabbing, bleeding, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need to ask what kind of knife it was, based on the wounds? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short-blade folding knife... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or whose face Martinez picked out of the mug-shots I brought him? No. No need. A beat. Raul's dog barks from outside. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course the story goes on from there. From there it's about the lawyer Martinez gets himself...
RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to yourself... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores, on a roll now) The lawyer who just assumes he did it because of the DNA. The lawyer who gets him the best deal he can, and feels pretty good, because the deal keeps his client off Death Row... and this guy, this lawyer, he's all about the deal, see? RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick-- You can't beat yourself up for what you didn't know-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw him and he's twenty-six going on forty. He's a little guy. You know what happens to the little ones up there. A beat. Mick drinks. MICK (CONT'D) (SUDDENLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a type. Roulet. It's more than a type, Renteria and Campo, you put their faces together you get the same face... RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the drink Mick takes) You better take it easy... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I was thinking about this the whole way down on the plane-- That night with Renteria? It was like he hit the jackpot-- got to do his thing and get away with it. Then he's in a bar, sees Reggie-- RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who he's seen before, remember-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but tonight he sees who she looks like.
RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renteria? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And he's right back there. RAUL (DOUBTFUL--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick, we're talking about a really STRANGE-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about a killer at work. You know that video from the bar? Just like you, he saw that Mr. X was left-handed. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struck by this) Smart as the devil-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows what he's doing. Reggie's the luckiest woman alive. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think there are others? With that face, or-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find out. Dig into Roulet. (recalls...) "All you'll find is parking tickets," I don't buy that anymore. Check out knife-murders of women. Not just the unsolved ones, Martha Renteria was a closed case. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, I can't throw a net like that. I'm just one guy! You gotta bring the cops in. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. He's my client. (clear on this:) That's why he hired me. Raul looks up, startled by this. Mick lays it out...
MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about that on the plane too: He was worried I might hear about the case and put it together. But if he was my client, I'd be bound to keep my mouth shut and protect him. RAUL (SEES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attorney-client privilege. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you: He knows what he's doing. RAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one guy in prison for what your other client did. What are you going to do, Mick? A beat. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, EXT. MICK HALLER'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Lincoln in front. Mick, working on Raul's question. Trudg up the steps. PHONE RINGS before he gets in, he fumbles k INT. HOUSE - KITCHEN... AS HE ANSWERS... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Haller... MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get my messages? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, no, I was up in San Francisco for the day... MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you weren't. You don't go to San Francisco, you go to San Quentin. Must have been seeing a client... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always were too smart for me. Is Hayley okay?
MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good. Look, she's playing soccer tomorrow, and she wants you to come to the match. You've started something, Mickey... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I look forward to it. MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need to pick her up at noon. But, under this, he sees, DOWN THE HALLWAY, light from a room. Sudden chill. Angling to see, keeping a normal voic MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noon, I'll do that. See you then. And hangs up before she can say goodbye.. And Stops. Free Eyes on the LIGHT at the end of the hall. Carefully, Mick begins to move down the hall... Pauses at the door he comes to first, bedroom, dark... Kicks it-- Nothing. starts walking again, when: there's a SOUND. Then silence. What was it?... Mick continues-- to- The LIT ROOM: SIDE ANGLE, we see it's the den-- Mick brac And BURSTS IN SUDDENLY: INT. DEN - LOUIS IS THERE... Sitting in Mick's chair, leg up on the desk... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny thing is I've been here before. I was offered the house to show, never gave back the key-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over,doesn't give a shit) Get out of my house! Now! LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising, but) EASY MICK--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sees Mick noticing-- the ELECTRONIC ANKLET on his le
LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend Valenzuela put this on. A tracer. As if I were going anywhere. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said Get up! Get up and get out of this house! Off Mick's force, Mick's almost crazy-- Louis smirks, goe EXT. FRONT DOOR, PORCH - MOMENT LATER, AS THEY COME OUT.. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to him, to "EXPLAIN")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't reach you! I'm on trial for my life, Mick, and I get nervous when I can't reach yout And you were away all day. Like you told "Maggie." Meaning he listened to the call. Mick goes white. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't come near this house again, do you understand me? We aren't friends, we aren't partners, you're my client, eriod-- LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I wanted to remind you of. I'm your client. Mick reacts. Louis lets in sink in, then: LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I like it in your house, Mick... Pretty pictures of your kid, Hayley... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucken don't. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't what, don't say she's pretty? But I saw her, the other day at the club... At which, Mick's had enough: belts Louis in the mouth. Qu solid.
His lip bloodied, Louis flashes with anger-- but then, ju as suddenly, he steels himself. Glares coldly at Mick. LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay I'm going. But-- And extends his hand: with Mick's house-key in it. LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --first I think I should give you back your key. It isn't right that I have it. Now that we can trust each other. Mick takes the key. Panting, he watches Louis go down the fucking steps.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDEN CUT TO,, EXT. ON HAYLEY
dialogues.text: Hayley, defending, scrambles to get in the way of another girl, a forward, dribbling towards her... ANGLE MICK, on the sideline... among other parents... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Hayley, get in her way! Hayley isn't quick enough, the forward dribbles round her goes in for the score. Hayley looks despondently at Mick- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, honey! When-- his CELL-PHONE RINGS. Into it-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Haller... He strains to listen... Stops cold. His look darkens... E from the field, Hayley sees this...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. RAUL'S BUNGALOW
dialogues.text: MOVING ON THE CUT, WITH MICK, as he ENTERS... It's a CRIM SCENE, swarms with cops, forensics, technicians... Mick distressed, moves as if through heavy water. DETECTI are leading him: LANKFORD, 38, clean-marine-- and HEIDI SOBEL, 30. They wear paper booties, thin rubber gloves...
LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levin was back in his office... SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't have found him if a neighbor hadn't brought the dog back. It was running loose. LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows a desk calendar) Your name's all over this. Were you the only guy he worked for? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I've got a big trial next month, attempted rape and murder. He was helping me. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the Roulet case? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know? SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because every file that's been rifled has the name. LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing, Roulet himself is already cleared for this. We've checked the tracking on his tracer- anklet and it doesn't show him anywhere near this place. And there's no way to trick those things, no way in the world. We see Mick register this-- wants to ask about it, but be HE CAN-- LANKFORD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, Counsellor, where were you this morning? Mick rocked by the question. What it means. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a suspect? SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew whoever shot him. There are no signs of forcible, he even let the killer into the back room.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching my daughter play soccer. A couple of dozen people can confirm I was there. Provisionally buying this, Lankford takes out booties. LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put these on and don't touch anything back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul face down on the floor, in front of his desk chair. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell us if you see anything unusual? Mick draws close. Lankford, abruptly-- LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I see are pictures of a guy. Was he a fruit? MICK (BITTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a hell of an ex-cop, is what he was. Crimes Against Persons, back in Chicago. And yeah he was gay, and what the hell's that got to do with it? If the murder was some kind of gay thing, why'd they ransack the office? Isn't it obvious they were looking for something to do with his work? Lankford can't argue with this. When Sobel, near the body SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. The position of his hands. ANGLE: Two middle fingers point down. Two outside fingers LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this guy a Longhorns fan or what? Or is it some kind of sign, like he was trying to tell us who SHOT HIM-- (MAKES "HORNS")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --"The devil did it?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from the POV OF--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives the street, his focus pumped up... until he com to: A HOUSE, its garage door wide open. Mick pulls into t drive behind it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he FINDS inside, beside a family van, is a LARGE THI CARDBOARD BOX... It's upright, marked "Fragile."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick stands there KNOCKING at the door. It's opened by: VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mick! Val's surprised... a mix of emotions... VAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' here?... and I heard about Raul Levin, man... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores all that) You know your garage door's open? VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit: I just had a plasma delivered... And rushes to... the GARAGE. Mick trails... Val's relieve find the box is okay. VAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, if we still lived in Van Nuys this sucker'd be gone. Set me back eight grand, too. But it's gonna be great for the games... (notes Mick's silent mood) What's up anyway? What brings you out here?
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raul's murder. (Val waits, listens.) I've been with the cops. They can't tie Roulet to it, because your ankle bracelet doesn't put him near the house. VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I gave them the trace. The bracelet's got a mass detector, there's no way to beat that. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the cops ask you where you were this morning, Val? Val's slow at first, to register just what Mick's asking. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, some way, Louis killed Raul Levin. And it didn't show up on the trace. Mick looks at the plasma TV, then back at Val. Val redden VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not be sayin' what I think-- that I cut him loose-- to let him kill Raul--? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you didn't know what he was going to do-- VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, angry--) You think I'd let that happen? For a fuckin' TV? And he lunges at Mick, shoves him back agains the van, Mi shoves back, harder, backwards into the TV box-- it hits cement floor, hard, and Val falls on top of it-- Sickening snap/crunch from within the box-- VAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, man-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the money for an eight thousand dollar TV, Val?
VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit! I didn't do that! How dare you say that to me-- I'm inocente, man-- Mick reacts to the word-- Martinez's word-- as Val glares him from the ground. VAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outa here; Get out of here, Mick, and get outa my life! Mick's already backing off-- towards the car-- VAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going, man! Mick keeps going-- down the drive and into his car-- CUT INT. FOUR GREEN FIELDS - NIGHT - MICK AT THE BAR... Drinking, CAMERA moves on him, he taps the glass for anot Bartender comes over like he's going to pour one. Mick's are on the bar-- Instead of pouring the bartender swipes the keys. Mick lo at him, uncomprehending. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. You're done here, pal. And you're not driving either. (shows keys, keeps them) Call yourself a cab or something. Off Mick,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGGIE, lugs him into his room, he's a mess... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being married to you sucked but it beat being a car service... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea, y'know. Car service, with the Lincolns-- Drive the illustrious turds of our city back and forth to LAX--
MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be your first customer. First dollar. And rolls him onto the bed. He looks at her. Drunk as he MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme ask you something. Corliss. The name Corliss. You didn't just give me that just because you'd been drinking. You wanted me to have it. She doesn't confirm or deny. Just gets him into bed-- say POINTEDLY-- MAGGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying. He knows, but-- one thing more-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie-- Raul. Did I get him killed? Moved, she shakes her head no. Straightens his pillow. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do it, Haller? You're a sleazy defense lawyer with two ex- wives and a daughter, and we all still love you. We STAY ON HIM as she stands up, goes. To no one: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in bad shape as he comes out of the bedroom. Stares the light pouring in from the glass doors onto the porch. Finds: THERE'S A DOLLAR TAPED TO THE GLASS. (From Maggie. Also: the MESSAGE LIGHT ON HIS PHONE is ON. MOMENTS LATER: He's pressed the button, listens to... MACHINE VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message received: YESTERDAY, ELEVEN- SEVEN A.M.
RAUL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick, it's me. Guess I missed you. Wanted to go over a few things, so I wouldn't interrupt your day with Hayley. Anyway... Presses STOP. Raul's voice: Mick's not sure he can deal. pulls the pencil & pad near him, and presses START ag RAUL'S VOICE (cont'd) First, that witness name you gave me. Corliss? Turns out he's this hype, Dwayne Jeffrey Corliss, sometimes goes by "DJ." When you run it that way you find out he's played the courtroom snitch a lot, mostly in Arizona. But here's the thing: One time down there? It blew up on him. I'm working on it, it can be good for us... Don't know how we get to him, though. They put him in USC lock-up, just to make it harder... Under which Mick, excited, is writing down D J CORLISS... ARIZONA... then USC, circles this last... RAUL'S VOICE (cont'd) Other thing is, you asked me to dig deep-on Roulet? Mick, I found something. I found Martinez' ticket out of the Q. When, on the tape he hears DOG BARKING... and a DOOR BELL RAUL'S VOICE (cont'd) Uh, that's somebody at the door... Look, have a good time with your kid. Gotta go, boss. And MESSAGE goes OFF. Mick thinks a moment. Tries to clea his head. Then pulls out a card and dials a number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOBEL (ANSWERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Sobel. MICK (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Haller. (MORE)
MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I-- just checked my phone messages. It turns out Raul called me. Just before he was killed. I didn't know. (SHE REACTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message came at Eleven-oh- seven. He said, "I think I found Martinez' ticket out of the Q." SOBEL (WRITING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning Jesus Martinez-- that's a former client of yours-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In San Quentin. Right. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say anything else? Looks down at his notes. At "Corliss." "USC." A beat. As tears off the note, stuffs it in his pocket... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- No, that's it. Then the dog barked, somebody was at the door. He hung up. (before she can ask more) Look, maybe you can tell me if there's any progress on the case. (when she hesitates) He was my friend. Sobel, makes a decision... SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we did catch a break. We found a bullet casing in the room, from a 22. It turns out Levin owned a .22, but when we checked it out it wasn't a Woodsman, like the gun that killed him... To which, Mick reacts... as she goes on... SOBEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other thing is we can't find his cell-phone... (noticing Mick is silent) Are you still there?
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... just, I'll let you know if I think of anything. About his cell- phone, I mean. Thanks. And hangs up. Too sudden. Leaves Sobel wondering... CUT TO, MICK MOVING QUICKLY THROUGH HIS HOUSE... Down the hall, to a closet, climbs clumsily above to a sh Tossing clothes out of the way... Finds: AN OLD WOODEN GU BOX. The top has a brass plate: COLT "WOODSMAN." Mick, in a cold sweat, opens the box. It's EMPTY. Suddenl EXT. HOUSE - MICK STEPS OUT ONTO THE PORCH... For air-- He can hardly breathe-- straightens his thought Takes the note from his pocket, studies it. INT. USC-COUNTY LOCK-UP - MOVING WITH MICK... GUARD leads him DOWN A HALL... leads him to a room and le him there. With GLORIA. In prison jumper. Faint smile. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria I'm not here about you. I'm here about me. I need your help. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Louis, lanky, graceful, takes a seat at the DEFENSE TABLE Mick, sorts papers. Louis, turns, seems to watch him... ANGLES, THE GALLERY: DOBBS and MARY WINDSOR, she's on edg but hides-- Also LORNA, to support Mick. While, AT THE TA LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick. I want to tell you something before we start.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better make it fast. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my lawyer, right? So I can tell you anything, even a crime I've committed, and you have to keep it secret. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, uncomfortable--) That's right. Unless it's one you're going to commit. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've killed people, Mick. Reaction Mick. Just then, Courtroom clerk gives a warning COURTROOM CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes, people... MICK (TO LOUIS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? Now? Why now, are you telling me this... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know your plan. Mick looks at him. Before he can deny-- LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your plan is to defend me on this-- then, when I'm not your client, throw me to the cops. (when Mick says nothing) I can't let that happen. So I'm telling you: I've killed people and guess what? Martha Renteria was one of them. There now. If you use what I've told you you might get Jesus Martinez out of jail, but you'll never practice law again. And I'll never be prosecuted. I think it's called fruits of the poisoned tree-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Cuts Louis off, rises, leads him... past prosecution tabl TED MINTON turns, watches them... as Mick leads Louis out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly spins on Louis and puts him against a wall. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch. You killed Raul. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right about one thing. I am a son of a bitch. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do it? The trace said you weren't even in Glendale... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was getting too close. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanks Louis's lapels) You piece of shit, do you think you have this wired? You don't! LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do have an insurance policy. He grabs Mick's wrists. Strong: pulls them off his chest. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my gun, Louis-- LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk away from this trial a free man-- and remain free-- and it never falls into wrong hands. The deal. Mick's close to hitting him-- when the door ope COURTROOM CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Fullbright is on the bench. INT. COURTROOM - MOMENTS LATER - MICK AND LOUIS ENTER... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice of you to join us... She's 46, bad hair, tough. Mick's off on the wrong foot. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What this case is about is a predator... On the night of March Sixth, Louis Roulet was out stalking his prey... Jury of twelve, two alternates... TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going to hear from the victim herself about her lifestyle, one that we would not condone. But remember that anyone, anyone, can be the victim of a violent crime. (approaches the jury box) The case is clear. Straightforward. A man attacked a woman in her home in order to rape and kill her. It is only by the grace of God that she's here to tell you the story. Over Ted,

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Michael Haller, and I'm representing Louis Roulet. (glances at Ted) Mr. Minton doesn't want to use the word prostitute for the woman who's supposed to be Louis's victim. He needn't worry, this case isn't about how she makes her money... But it is about her actions. How she saw a young man with signs of wealth, and chose to target him... (closes in on the jury...) What she didn't count on, was you. The fact that you'd put two and two together, and let your common sense tell you who was the real predator.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. COURTROOM CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: As Mick exits with Lorna for the lunch-break. Low-voiced- LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a message from Gloria. She thinks she can do what you asked. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinks? LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corliss has the same meal time. She can try. MICK (DISCOURAGED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her try. But it may not matter. LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Corliss isn't on the witness list. It could be Ted Minton is holding him back. He won't use him until he has to. Until I screw up his case so bad he has no choice. LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey? Can you do that? Off Mick, tries for a confident smile...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE COP, (MAXWELL)
dialogues.text: I'd describe Ms. Campo when we got there as... hurt and frightened... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened? OFFICER MAXWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kept asking us if she was safe, even after Roulet was taken away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTROOM, LATER
dialogues.text: Mick has Maxwell on cross... Clerk hands her pages... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, would you read from your arrest report where it's marked? OFFICER MAXWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The victim does not know the man who assaulted her or why she was attacked." MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you write that she didn't know him? OFFICER MAXWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's what she said. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, she just opened the door at ten o'clock to a stranger? OFFICER MAXWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't put it like that... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there blood on his right hand? OFFICER MAXWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused by the shift) No, his left. Or we would have bagged his right one, too. INT. CAMERA TRAILS THE JURY... As a new witness is on the stand, Ted's witness... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Talbot, you were with Miss Campo on the night of March Sixth? CHARLES TALBOT, 48, the customer from the video. Blurred tattoos on muscled forearms, dyed blonde hair. TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Had a date with her at Morgan's. Then from there we went to her place and had another date, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: B5.
dialogues.text: Air of a sleaze-ball sex-player, but calm and good-humore TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had you known Miss Campo before? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Just called her up. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know to call her? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her website. She's got a real good website. Jury laughs a little. Fascinated but repulsed by this guy but Fullbright stirs, disliking Talbot's tone... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have sexual relations? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred bucks worth. And she earned every cent. Angle a male JUROR, red-faced with disapproval. Mick catc his reaction, likes it. Ted goes on... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what time did you leave? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five minutes before ten. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She say she had another engagement? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she acted like she was done for the night... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, I don't think Mr. Talbot's qualified to interpret Ms. Campo's thinking or plans... TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just mean she acted satisfied... FULLBRIGHT (OFFENDED--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained! Go on, Mr. Minton.
TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you left, what condition was she in? Was she hurt? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she was fit as a fiddle. I know because I'd just played her. (before Fullbright bursts) Sorry, your honor. She was fine. Minton goes, lifts a sheet over an easel, REVEALS the blo up PHOTOS of the Reggie's battered face. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't look like this? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. What kind of bastard does something like that? FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question. TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We made consensual and pleasurable love. Which is what life is all about. Then I paid her. CUT TO, MICK HAS TALBOT ON CROSS... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Talbot, are you right or left- handed? TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left. And isn't it true that before you left Regina Campo asked you to strike her repeatedly in the face? TED (OBJECTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, there's no basis for this sort of questioning. Mr. Haller is just muddying the waters with outrageous statements. Fullbright looks to Mick for a reply. Mick half-shrugs...
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the defense theory, Judge. FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness can answer. TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never hit her or any other woman. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know a prostitute named... (checks his sheet) Shaquille Barton? "Shaquilla Shakels" is her work name. TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, yeah. I seen her one time... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I brought her here and she said you had struck her with your left hand... TALBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd be lying. I tried Shaquilla, that rough stuff's not for me. I'm a missionary man. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a strong left. Thank you. And Mick sits-- drawing a nasty look from Ted for this la and a pleased one from Louis. CUT TO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Mick, as he exits the courtroom for the day, is

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISED TO FIND
dialogues.text: HIM. Sobel holds documents. Reaction Mick: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. BACK SEAT, DETECTIVES' CAR, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Mick looks over the pages Sobel hands him. Lankford drive MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This warrant is bullshit-- LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough to search your house. For a Woodsman registered to you.

dialogues.speaker: BB.
dialogues.text: SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to run ballistics on it. She turns around: The good cop, but she's hurt: SOBEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would have been better if you'd told me that you had a Woodsman. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't anymore. It was stolen. The worst yet. Lankford laughs: "How convenient..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOX FOR THE WOODSMAN: Sobel in gloves, examines, whil LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the history on the piece. Turns out it belonged to Mickey Cohen the gangster, in the forties. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. My father represented him. He got him off for using it in self- defense, so Cohen made him a present of it. Sobel, careful, opens it... It's empty. Like Mick said. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you report it stolen? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I knew who took it. (They look at him.) A client. He told me, so I couldn't turn him in without breaking a trust. They do that. LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't buy this) Still and all, mind if I look around? Just in case you haven't had time to toss it off a pier? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go crazy. You've got the warrant. Lankford sneers, starts for the next room. To Sobel--
LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi-- bag the box. He leaves. As she bags it-- He wonders why. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do ballistics on a box. She glances, seeing Lankford's gone-- explains. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That old Mickey Cohen shooting? It's kind of famous. It turns out the county still has the evidence in storage. The bullet. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can match casings to a slug that's fifty years old? SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be easier with the gun, but yeah. She goes to join her partner. Mick stops her with-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective? How long will ballistics take? SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. You'll make me think you're worried what we'll find. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the middle of a trial. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A day. Maybe forty-eight hours. She leaves. Mick's gaze, in the mirror: Fear. INT. COURTROOM - NEXT MORNING - ARRIVING... Mick and Ted, at the same time. As they move to the front TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Haller. Word is, you had interesting visitors last night...
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worry about yourself, Ted. You're dying the death of a thousand razors up there and you don't even know it. They peel off-- Mick to the defense table, where Louis wa for him. Before Louis can speak: Low-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you little shit: This gun- scheme of yours is about to blow up, and I'm not going down for it. If I have to drive people to the airport the rest of my life. Mick is seething. Louis smiles. Unruffled. INT. COURTROOM, LATER - TED RISES... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last witness, your honor. The prosecution calls Regina Campo. INT. COURTROOM, LATER - REGGIE ON THE STAND... Diminutive, conservative dress, dark curls around her pre face-- none of the aggressive sexiness. Hesitant but fran REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true that I lied. I knew him when he came to the door. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, you'd arranged his coming Miss Campo: why did you lie? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared. I wasn't sure the police would believe me and I wanted to make sure they arrested him... because he's an animal... She looks tentatively at Louis, as if still scared-- then looks away. Louis is blank. Mick takes it in. Ted follows TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you regret that decision now?
REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. If it helps him to get free and do this to somebody else. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, prejudicial-- JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained. But ANGLE THE JURY: the damage is done. Reggie's moved th TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no further questions for Regina, your honor. Ted sits. JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your witness, Mr. Haller. Mick about to rise when-- Louis grabs his hand. Low-voice LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to remind you of your words. You were going to tear her apart and throw her entrails into the sea. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, keep acting like you pull the strings. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller. Emphatic. Mick frees his hand, straightens himself. watch by Louis. Then all at once, to surprise her-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Campo have you engaged an attorney to sue Mr. Roulet for the events of March Sixth? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovers, No I haven't. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But have you talked to an attorney?
REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't hired anybody or-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked if you talked to one. About a possible lawsuit. Mick's crisp like he knows for sure. She wilts a little. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing more than talk... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ask if you could sue Mr. Roulet for damages? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought what you say to lawyers is private. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wish, you can tell the jurors. Faces her. Ted squirms, seeing the box she's in. REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I want to keep it private. Ted squirms again. Wrong answer. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go back to the night at Morgan's. Had you ever seen Louis Roulet before that night? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. There and other places. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever noticed he wore a Rolex watch? REGGIE NO-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or that he drove one of two cars, a Porsche or a Range Rover? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw him driving.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what made you approach him? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew he was in the life. You know. A player. I had seen him leave with girls who do what I do. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With prostitutes. To go to a hotel, or their apartments...? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you know they left? Maybe they just went out for a smoke... REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they got in his car and drove away. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you just testified that you never saw Mr. Roulet drive! Now you saw him leave with a prostitute like yourself. Which is it? The contradiction rings round the room. Reggie, tries... REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him get in a car but I didn't know what kind it was. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the difference between a Porsche and a Range Rover? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one's big and one's small, I guess. Reactions... Reggie shakes her head, knows she's not maki it... But Mick, like he's just getting started... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women he left with, when you saw them again, had they been beaten or injured? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I didn't ask.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But girls in your profession talk about customers, don't you? Warn each other if someone's a freak... REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, usually... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how many had warned you about Louis Roulet? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None. No one. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you believed you'd be safe? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, thought he was a known quantity and I needed the money, so... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you thought he could solve your need for money? REGGIE NO-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Isn't that why we're sitting here? Because you zeroed in on him? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I mean yes, but not like that-- (looking round, a plea to BE BELIEVED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He attacked me, I swear!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. COURTROOM, LATER
dialogues.text: The BAR TAPE, blown-up projection, SHOWS REGGIE PASSES LO SITTING AT THE BAR, LEANS HER BODY INTO HIM SEXILY... ANGLE COURTROOM, ON REGGIE watching the tape. Also JURORS reacting, enthralled, and Mick watching them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME COURT, Mick signals the TECHNICIAN. It goes OFF.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did the napkin say, Ms. Campo? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name and address... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your price? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Four hundred dollars. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) It's a hard line of work... REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And dangerous. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, haven't you told friends you were looking for a way out? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm not proud of what I do-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, isn't it true-- nothing would be easier to understand-- that you saw Louis Roulet and his money as a way out? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's not what this is about! That man hit me and tried to kill me. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we've heard you say that-- (TO FULLBRIGHT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge may I ask the witness to stand up? JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, but) The witness will stand. I hope you're going somewhere with this, Mr. Haller. Reggie stands.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you please, walk over to my client. She goes, stands before Louis. Who rises on cue from Mick MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the man you broke free from, overpowered, knocked out? REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes-- You can do amazing things when you're afraid-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you weigh, Ms. Campo? Because your website REGGIE-FOR-FUN- DOT-COM says one hundred three... REGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. A beat. Louis sits. Reggie stands there... suddenly cries MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no further questions for the witness, your honor. Reggie returns to a seat behind the prosecutor's table. W we pick up TED MINTON. Staring at Mick, hiding the sense damage as best he can... He's startled when: JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Minton? Do you have another witness for us? Ted rouses, summons confidence, rises... WHILE, ASIDE, Louis to Mick, re Ted... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks worried. Mick watching Ted, waits, tense... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The state rests, your honor. Mick's disappointed: No Corliss. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not worried enough.
JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises a gavel...) Then the defense will call its first witness after lunch. And the gavel comes down. INT. COURTROOM, AFTER THE BREAK - MICK, ON DIRECT, HAS... MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I recognize this knife. (holding an evidence bag) It's the one my son carried with him for protection for the last four years. Almost exactly. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he need protection? MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because realtors alone in a house are sometimes robbed or hurt... Even raped or murdered. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But has Louis ever been the subject of such a crime? MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But he knew someone who... (hesitates...) MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, please. MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was raped and robbed by a man. Louis found her. It was terrible. The first thing he did afterwards was get himself a knife to carry, at all times. (looks at Ted Minton) March Sixth would have been no different.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTROOM, LATER
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Windsor, you seemed pretty exact, about when your son started carrying around this, this weapon, a five-inch folding knife... MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. The incident took place on June ninth, two-thousand-one. Mick watches Ted, carefully... Cat and mouse... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it in the newspapers? MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, do you somehow remember because the police came to talk to Louis... MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no police investigation. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how can you remember the exact date so well? (sly look at Mick) Were you given the date before testifying here? MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the date because I'll never forget the day I was attacked. The news falls on Ted. She goes on before he can rally... MARY WINDSOR (cont'd) Louis will never forget it either. He found me in that house, tied up. Naked. It was traumatic for him. She's perfect: a strong woman, unused to showing emotion. Mick smiles, impressed. When, with some sarcasm: JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Minton-- anything else? Ted, still thrown, stares down at his notes.
TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Louis's mother, you'd do or say anything to save him, wouldn't you? MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't lie. Not about what happened that day... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no police or hospital record that it even occurred... MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never reported it... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was ashamed. If you don't understand that I can't explain it to you. And yet I live with it every day. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's only you who says so: Mary looks at Ted, and at the Judge, as if confused: MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a question? Off Mick, admiring, GO TO, INT. COURTROOM - POST-ADJOURNMENT, END OF DAY... Mick packing his stuff-- looks up, as Ted approaches. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about the thousand razors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis waits on the steps, Mick comes out. Where they're alone... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had an offer. Want to spend six months in county jail?
LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you from the beginning-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know: The only verdict's Not Guilty. Okay. We'll get there. Grateful for this, Louis puts a hand on Mick's arm. But: MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me, Louis. You want to show your gratitude give me my gun back. Louis grins: meaning No way. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still sure you want me to put you on the stand? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist on it. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get some rest tonight, you're up next. Leaving Louis, Mick continues down the steps, to where th Lincoln waits. He gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl in the front seat. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I need you to get me, Earl. A tone Earl never heard him use before. Earl turns around CUT TO, INT. COURTROOM - NEXT DAY - CRISP... Mick steps past Ted on his way to his desk. As he passes- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to your client? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. No deal.
Ted feigns surprise-but-acceptance... While, TO THE JUDGE MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense calls Louis Ross Roulet, your honor. INT. COURTROOM, LATER - LOUIS ANSWERS ON DIRECT... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turned toward the living room, the way she pointed... ANGLE MICK, has a floorplan of the apartment, on an easel MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happened when you turned? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something hit me and I blacked out. I don't know for how long. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was all? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then when I woke up these guys were on me, telling me not to move. I couldn't anyway. I was too scared. Mick moves toward Louis, as if determined to find flaws.. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, there was blood on your jacket and your left hand... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone put it there because I didn't. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you left-handed? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't strike Ms. Campo with your left fist? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threaten to rape her, or kill her?-- LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're angry. Why? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passionate but simple--) Do you know what it's like to be accused of something like this? To listen to people tell lies about your having done something so sick and awful? I, I understand I had to be quiet and wait my chance and not say anything-- but if guilty people have rights, what about innocent people? I am innocent! Mick. Meets Louis's eye, communicates: You were perfect. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing further, Judge. Ted already up & moving, passes Mick as he takes his TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to you, Ms. Campo punched herself or had a man she never met before punch her lights out as part of a set-up? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that I didn't. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this knife you always carry, how did she know she'd find it on you as part of the set-up? LOUIS ("HONEST")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She couldn't, could she? I mean, I never took it out or showed it to anybody-- so she must have just found it when she went into my pocket for the money I had that I was going to pay her with, right?--

dialogues.speaker: M.
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really prefer it if I ask the questions, and you answer them! (then calming himself) Would you look at this, please-- Goes to the easel, REVEALS: PHOTO of Reggie's beaten face TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell us again if you think Regina Campo would or could have done this to herself. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who did it, but it wasn't me. Nobody deserves that to happen... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seizes on this) What do you mean by "deserves?" Do you mean crimes of violence come down to a whether a woman gets what she "deserves?" LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back at him) I mean no matter what she does for a living or who she is-- No woman deserves that. Ted keeps staring at the photo: Wants the jury looking th TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no more questions. At which, suddenly there's a wave of movement-- SLOW-MOTI Louis dismissed from the chair-- Ted returning to his sea passing Mick as Mick rises-- Louis gives Mick a "How'd I do?" look, Mick nods, unmistakably, "You did fine..."-- Mick's look finds Ted-- Mick and Ted holding each other in a gaze-- Mick's face i kind of smile, Ted grim-- As Mick brings out, speaking to the Judge but his smiling eyes fixed on the unhappy Ted-- RESUME NORMAL SPEED for Mick's confident, fateful words: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, the defense rests.
Ted hears this, sets his jaw. Fullbright turns to him. JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Minton? Ted is uncertain... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor... (She waits.) The state needs the night to decide, your honor... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To decide what? TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly I wasn't anticipating the defense would rest after two witnesses. I-- I'd like the night to consider calling a rebuttal witness. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts, "objects--") Your honor, first we've heard of THIS-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said `-consider." I need to find out if the witness is even AVAILABLE-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The state still has an obligation to disclose the identity-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I decide not to use him. (a note of pleading) I'm begging the court's indulgence, your honor. Fulbright doesn't like it... but weighs, yields. Go to, CRACK OF THUNDER: EXT. NIGHT SKY, CLOUDS, RAIN. REVEAL... It's the vast view from Mick's porch. He has a drink in h hand. And holds a phone to his ear... MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a rumor in the office...
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I'm the one who shot Raul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the BG we SEE HAYLEY, in pajamas, jumping on her bed.. Maggie closes the bedroom door so she can speak... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haller, is this serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say so. I'm being set up for his murder. Couple of detectives from Glendale are following me around, just waiting for the go- ahead to hit me with an arrest warrant... Could be any minute... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is this possible? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad timing, bad client, me being dumb... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Roulet? Is that the client? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk to you about my clients. How is Hayley? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But Haller, if she ever hears anything about this-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't. Not if I play it right. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? A long beat. Then he says, just as he told Raul-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. I have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. LINCOLN, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MICK, in the back seat. Looking out at the rain. look a little different: close shave, neat suit. Fade up sound of Earl, meanwhile, rattling on... EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .when Not Guilty Two gets to four thousand miles, that's two cars ready, that's enough to start the airport runs... Scene we saw at the opening. Mick absorbed... Earl notice EARL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gettin' any of this, Mr. Haller? Mick opens the file (back-seat office extraordinarily nea Top of the print-out: THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF CALIFORN vs. LOUIS ROULET...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VAN NUYS COURTHOUSE, MORNING
dialogues.text: Earl holds an umbrella over Mick, they hurry into the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The items in his briefcase checked, wand passed over him. INT. COURTHOUSE - CORRIDOR - ON MICK'S BACK... As he moves down the hall. Everything counts today. Enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted prepares at his table. Look at each other without greeting-- as Mick moves to the CLERK, who shuffles paper MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I'm getting coffee. Any for you? CLERK BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man, I'm off caffeine...
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is that the custody list? Can I see if any of my no-good clients are on it? Bill lets him have it. Mick, casual, looks over the names

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORNA, she's paying for a take-out coffee, when Mick scoo her up by the arm, urgent, he's been looking for her-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minton's putting on Corliss. He's got him in lock-up already... LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gloria still hasn't let us know if she got to him! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she had mealtimes to work it... LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances. Meantime did you serve Kurlen? Moving her OUT OF THE CAFE, DOWN THE HALL-- hushed & LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but I didn't like forging the judge's signature... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did. LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did. Just then, approaching, he sees SOBEL & LANKFORD: Are coming for him? No, they turn into the courtroom along wi others showing up for the trial's last day. Relieved-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go, and be ready for my call. Lorna starts to go-- then pauses.
LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crazy about the power suit. Extra flip to her hips as she goes because Mick's watchin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sooner enters than KURLEN's in his face, waves a docum KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shit is this, Haller? I got nothing to do with your case! Mick, "innocent," inspects the papers. With surprise-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subpoena to appear as a witness? You'll just have to wait and see. It's a legal document, Detective. Cursing, Kurlen takes himself off to a corner. Leaving Mi with the "legal document." He tucks it away-- And continues to the front-- Past CECIL DOBBS and MARY WINDSOR, to LOUIS, at the defense table. OVER WHICH, PRE-

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE FULLBRIGHT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Minton-- INT. COURTROOM, MINUTES LATER - COURT'S IN SESSION... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the state have any rebuttal? TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises, ready) The state calls Dwayne Jeffrey Corliss as rebuttal witness. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge? Who is this witness? Why wasn't I told before now? JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fair question. Mr. Minton? TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne Corliss is a cooperating witness who spoke with Mr. Roulet in custody, following his arrest.
LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts, suddenly--) Bullshit! I didn't to talk to-- JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, Mr. Roulet! Mr. Haller, control your client! Mick bends over, to Louis, sotto voce-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good. Now leave it to me. (to the court) I do share my client's outrage, your honor. I'd at least like to know how long the state has been sitting on this testimony... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Corliss did not come forward until yesterday. MICK (OUTRAGED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is incredible... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go back and talk to him? Given the timing I'd allow it. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Judge, we all know what this is, this is a jailhouse snitch, and anything he'd say would be a lie-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's groundless, your honor-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I just want my objection noted. JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm going to rule he can TESTIFY-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask one indulgence? Can I step into the hallway and make a call to an investigator? For whatever good it will do at this late date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick already dialling-- Lorna answering-- LORNA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, here. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your watch at quarter of. At ten fifteen you enter the room. LORNA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the printouts. LORNA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey, I know the moves! He snaps shut his cell-phone.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COURTROOM, MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Prison jumpsuit. We recognize him: the holding-cell junky TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Corliss, are you incarcerated at this time? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no, now I'm just in the courtroom. Dumb answer draws laughs. ANGLE LOUIS, seething... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are currently held in the jail-ward at USC hospital? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Since I got arrested. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For burglary and drug possession? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Do you know the defendant?     CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I met him in lock-up. We was bussed over from jail, and then we was together in the tank when we came for first appearance. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you talk at that time? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... we talked about how bad we needed cigarettes. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, "what are you in for?" Like that. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say what he was "in for?" CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said, "For giving a bitch exactly what she deserved." Those were his words. Reaction Louis, stirs like a caged animal. Mick steadies. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have only one more question. Have I, or has anyone, made you promises to get you to testify? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's the right thing to do. Ted sits. Judge turns to Mick-- who's just staring, angri Then rises. Like he doesn't know what to do. Louis, the others, watch anxiously. Mick crosses to the front, steal glance at the rear, SEES KURLEN standing against the wall LANKFORD AND SOBEL seated in front of him. Then... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times have you been arrested, Mr. Corliss? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About seven in L.A. Couple of times in Phoenix if you count those.
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know how the system works? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to survive... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sometimes that means ratting out fellow inmates, is that it? TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, your honor... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat, Mr. Minton. I gave you leeway bringing this witness in. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your honor. But I'll rephrase: How many times have you snitched on an inmate? Testified against a fellow inmate for the prosecution? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes my fourth. MICK (LOOKING SURPRISED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four times? People just come up and tell you they committed crimes so you can testify against them-- CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People talk to me. I'm a friendly guy. Mick, walks toward Louis, indicates him-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you and my client were friends-- CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, we was friendly-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he just said what you said he said, about what the woman "deserved," and then you went back to talking about cigarettes?
CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. He was like, bragging. He told me he did it before... Mick freezes... Like he's in a mine field and can't move. CORLISS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the other time he killed the bitch... He got away with it then and he would get away with it now. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Corliss) You... Wait... All eyes on Mick. The Judge prompts... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more questions, your honor. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Re-direct, your honor. Fullbright nods permission. While Louis leans over to Mic LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me! What did you say to this guy? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) Nothing! This is a set-up! You're doing this! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? How am I doing this? But Louis has no answer. Meanwhile Ted's taken the floor. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he was bragging. How? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like, he told me the details. About the other one, that he killed. (MORE)
CORLISS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called her a snake dancer. She danced in some joint where she was like in a snake pit. ANGLE, REACTION DETECTIVE KURLEN, he leans forward at thi SAME TIME, REACTION at the defense table: Mick, "alarmed, low to Louis-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he know this? LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I know? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you didn't tell him this shit somebody did. Who? Start thinking! RESUME Ted, moving closer to Corliss-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything else he told you? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that snake-girl stuff was it. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Then no further questions, your honor. Ted sits. The look he gives Mick in passing is one of abounding confidence. Mick stews... Swivels around... Covert glance, MICK'S POV, looks to see if Kurlen is wher was, against the wall. He's not. He's gone. So is Lankfor And the courtroom door still swings slightly, as if they' just left... While IN FRONT: JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any re-cross from the defense? Mick rises to answer, hesitates-- and just then turns to Lorna enter and approach down the aisle. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment with my staff, Judge? JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quick. He meets Lorna at the gate. Brings his head close to hers
LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where I whisper in your ear, tell you stuff... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a file from her) It's all here, right? You go now, I don't want anyone talking to you. LORNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. She goes, he returns to the table. Before Louis can speak MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on here, but it won't matter if it's two murders or a hundred if I can show he's a liar-- LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you set me up I swear I'll-- MICK
