dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me if there's anything else he knows. Anything else I have to stay away from. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know because I never talked to him. I'm not that stupid. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. If I destroy him none of it counts... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from his gut) Then destroy him. A command. Mick nods. Returns to the witness Corliss-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne, if I can call you that-- CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what people call me-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they also call you D.J.? For example, down in Phoenix, right?
CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. He's a bit wary. Mick looks through the file Lorna brough MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you know, my assistant, she was just reading on the internet about D.J. Corliss-- arrested in Phoenix, 1989 on drug charges-- Hometown of Mesa, Arizona? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'd be me. But-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Fred Bentley, right? Corliss, darkens, stumbles at this-- Ted's quick-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I object, your honor, where is the defense going with this? JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connect the dots soon, Mr. Haller. But the witness can answer. CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember any Bentley-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do. You testified that he confessed to you the crime he was charged with-- rape of a ten-year- old girl-- even though he denied his guilt in court. Am .I ringing any bells, D.J.? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-- 1989, I was high a lot, there's not much I recall-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd like you to read this to us, D.J. It's a printout of a news story from the Arizona Star, 1997, that's eight years after he was convicted. I ask that it be admitted into evidence-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor? A news report?
JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see where it takes us. The state can object later. Mick hands printout to the bailiff, who gives it to Corli MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've marked the paragraph. CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't too good at reading... (clears his throat) "A man, Frederick Bentley, wrongly convicted of rape, was released Saturday after con-- (HESITATES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --conclusive DNA results cleared him of the crime. The case was bolstered at trial by testimony from an informant, D.J. Corliss of Mesa, who claimed Bentley had-- bragged to him about the rape while together in a holding cell--" MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. (takes it from him) Were you charged with perjury for that incident, D.J.? CORLISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I was not. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that because the police were complicit in your confession? TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises, angry--) Judge, how can the witness know what went into the D.A.'s decision? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores, over--) Were you promised the same deal here, Mr. Corliss? To say that Louis Roulet "bragged" to you in the "holding cell?" JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Mr. Haller, that will do!
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ceases. Angry.) Sorry. I have no more questions. And Mick sits. Courtroom's hushed. Until-- JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm excusing the jury for an early lunch. Bailiff, see them out. Maintains a smile as the jurors leave. Then her smile die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sooner through the door-- than Fullbright wheels on Te JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Minton do you know what you have done? You've put a documented liar on the stand, a man with a record of putting innocent people IN PRISON-- TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, I-- JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut the fuck up when I'm talking to you! I can think of nothing more prejudicial or corrupt than what I just saw out therel (in a rage now--) Do you realize what you've done to my trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mick and Ted exit into hall-- Ted hurrying off, angry- Mick to LOUIS, DOBBS, and MARY WINDSOR-- tells them re Te MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to see his boss. To decide what to do before the judge comes down with a directed verdict. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a directed verdict? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it out of the jury's hand and declares an acquittal.
MARY WINDSOR (GLAD/HOPEFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll know in a few minutes. And heads off. Louis's cold stare, watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick at the urinal. Louis enters in and slides behind him LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not celebrating just yet, Mick. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I can see that. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know how Corliss got that shit he was saying. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go. You're getting what you want, I'm getting you off... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I want is get off for good. Leans into him. Pushes a hand into his back. A threat. LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better understand that. You've got enough reasons to be afraid of me already. When-- DOOR OPENS-- the courtroom CLERK, BILL, enters. CLERK BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting. CUT TO, INT. COURTROOM - MINUTES LATER - ON... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just spoke to the District Attorney, your honor. The state wishes to dismiss all charges. Here's a motion... Mick, Louis, watch Ted hand it to Fullbright...
TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It acknowledges that the procedures which guarantee justice were not followed in this case... JUDGE FULLBRIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she reads) This is a motion to dismiss with prejudice. No coming back. Ever. TED (WITH DIFFICULTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your honor. INT. COURTROOM, CORRIDOR - LATER - MARY WINDSOR... .tearful at the news, grips Mick's hand... she and Dobbs. MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller, thank you for my son... DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were splendid-- And Louis. Private, a few feet away. Smiles... LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I wasn't wrong about you... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the gun. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do. No more can be said, because Mrs. Windsor-- descends on M MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller, this time I insist you come to Orso for a celebration-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Mary would insist, but before she can, OUT OF THE ELEVATO comes KURLEN-- with LANKFORD AND SOBEL. Mick freezes, exp the worst-- but they move AROUND him and CLOSE IN ON: KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis Roulet, you are under arrest. Turn around and place your hands behind your back.
LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Kurlen cuffs him) Mick? This shouldn't be happening. Mrs. Windsor rushes Kurlen-- Sobel tries forcing her back MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Take your hands off my son! LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother. Louis' voice controls her. Stricken, Mary gives up. Then- DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you arresting him for? KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to take Louis) Suspicion of murder. The murder of Martha Renteria. DOBBS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That snake-dancer nonsense? Are you crazy? Everything that man Corliss said was a lie! Which stops Kurlen. He grins, confirmed. KURLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was all lies, how'd you know I meant the snake dancer? Dobbs sees his mistake. Kurlen begins again to take Louis MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment with my client, Detective? Kurlen nods, why not. Mick leads Louis a few steps away. MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, Louis. I got you off. Now get yourself a new lawyer. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're forgetting I have the gun... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you'll have to explain how you got it. But you know what? I've stopped giving a shit. You're going down, and Martinez is getting out, and that's all I care about. (MORE)
MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they stick that needle in your arm, that will be me. LOUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if I don't go down? But Mick's finished, ready to leave, though Louis persist LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't think they have enough to hold me. I could be out by tomorrow... You've got women, you've got a daughter... At this, Mick's head snaps to him, angrily... LOUIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't protect everybody. Kurlen arrives, takes Louis's elbow... Mick's already moving to the elevators... watched by SOBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOBEL catches up as MICK reaches the Lincoln. Stops him. move to beneath an overhang, where they're almost dry. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me you've got enough on Louis for the murder of Renteria. SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. We have the ticket. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ticket? SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking ticket, that Raul found. That was the phone message he left you... (Sees Mick doesn't know) Raul checked. Louis got one at a meter outside the victim's place, same time she was murdered. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Raul's murder? Do you have him for that?
SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We still don't know how he could have slipped the tracer anklet. (before Mick can ask more) Haller? Leave it alone. He hesitates-- but goes. Into the rain. Gets into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Sobel hurry back to courthouse through rain. W EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Haller? Got that thing you asked for. And he hands Mick something wrapped in a towel: A GUN. Mi puts it away, in the armrest. A bit regretful, because: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd never do this. Ask you to violate your parole. EARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called, lookin' out for your blood. Mick sits back. Earl pops in a RAP CD, TUPAC. TUPAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To be a man in this wicked land..."

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUES OVER
dialogues.text: HAND-HELD, MICK in windbreaker, jogging... RAP continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS RAP FADES, CAMERA TRAILS Mick's messy kitchen: take-ou pizza, beer bottles... and the GUN. Barrel protrudes from under the thrown-aside windbreaker. Mick's seen on the porch. PHONE RINGS, he rushes into ans MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?
MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick, it's Maggie... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh, I've been waiting for this. You're calling to congratulate me. MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen to me: Roulet is out! MICK (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? They've had him half a dayl

dialogues.speaker: /INTERCUT WITH, INT. D.A.'S OFFICE, MAGGIE'S DESK, SAME T
dialogues.text: MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... but the D.A. downtown said the detectives didn't have enough, they had to kick him... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it, they jumped the gun... dammit... MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've still got the parking ticket... and they're working forensics on the knife... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie... Look... There's more to this. Louis knows about Hayley. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes this in: furious:) What are you saying? How could you expose her to-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got her picture in the house! He saw itl Where is she now? MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, checks watch--) On the schoolbus-- the sitter's on the way to pick her up on Ventura, near the house--
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her on the cell and tell her not to take Hayley home, keep her with her til you get there! How long will it take you? MAGGIE TWENTY MINUTES-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me when you've reached the sitter. He hangs up. Thinking-- then dials a number--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "VAL" VALENZUELA. At his desk. Answers... VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valenzeula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val it's me. Mickey Haller. VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should hang up on you. The shit you talked to me! MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hang up, Val! I need a favor-- VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got balls even askin'-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's my family, Val. Maggie, Hayley-- they're in danger. VAL (COMPUTES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Roulet, right? MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he still have the ankle- bracelet on him?
VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he must, he didn't come by the office and I'm the only one can take it off... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then turn on the trace, Val. Now! CUT TO, MOMENTS LATER - ANGLE ON A GPS OF L.A... VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching it, into phone:) I got him... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's movin'... on Sunset... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming to my house? VAL (STUDIES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be, yeah, he's going west, heading up Laurel Canyon... Mick, nods... glance toward his gun... Then... PHONE BEEP his ear, Call Waiting-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay there, Val-- (switch/into phone) Maggie? MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reached the sitter, she'll keep Hayley at the bus-stop... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. As soon as you've got her, take her somewhere safe. And call me. (shifts calls/to Val--) Where is he, Val? VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see him but I don't know where he's goin'...
MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not goin' to your house. Sonofabitch sailed right past the turn... SCREEN, CURSOR travelling... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's he going? VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heading for the Valley. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, he's going to Maggie's. Keep track of him. Hangs up again. Looks around-- as if looking for an idea- then, frantic, looks up a number-- can't find it, finds i dials-- it rings-- Cold sweat til somebody answers-- MICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie? Eddie Vogel? It's Mick Haller...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BAR, NIGHT, MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: As the "ROAD SAINTS"-- EDDIE, HARD-CASE, others-- pour ou the bar, jump on their HARLEYS... ROAR OFF... inside whic the RINGING OF A PHONE brings us BACK TO-- INT. MICK IN HIS KITCHEN - ANXIOUS, ANSWERS... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? VAL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick, it's me... INT. VAL IN HIS OFFICE... STARING AT THE SCREEN... VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Maggie live? What street? MICK DICKENS1
VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's almost there, Mick. EXT. ROAD OVER THE CANYON - LOUIS ROULET'S PORSCHE... Descending on the valley side... EXT. STREET, VALLEY - THE ROAD ANGELS (MOVING)... Harleys pouring it on in formation, like fighter-jets... EXT. VENTURA BOULEVARD - RAIN - MAGGIE'S CAR... She screeches to the curb, hops out... School bus stop, w other parents wait, in cars, under umbrellas... Maggie ru forward, scans for the approaching bus... Nowhere in sigh

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO, INT. KITCHEN
dialogues.text: He's holding a phone, squeezing it, LISTENING TO A RING A THE OTHER END... To himself, a prayer... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie be there, Maggie pick up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands there, with the SITTER... SEES the bus approaching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her CELL-PHONE left on its dashboard rack, ringing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic for her to answer... MAGGIE'S VOICE (FINALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie!
MAGGIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've reached the cell-phone of Maggie McPherson... MICK

dialogues.speaker: DAMMIT
dialogues.text: Slams down the phone... Desperate, grabs his jacket, his flies towards the front door... OPENS it-- and MARY WINDSOR stands there. Before he speak She raises her hand and SHOOTS him. BRIGHT FLASH-- Nick's POV, Woozy-- he falls back, she raises her gun aga MARY WINDSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took my son away from me! She raises her gun again-- Mick FIRES AT HER FROM INSIDE JACKET. Her body jerks back, she falls... Mick, stunned, lies there... He watches, through the haze of his condition, as Mary Windsor's fallen body jerks, on the floor... CUT TO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate contorting his features, he's checking out the stree numbers through the DOWNWARD SLASH OF RAIN... WHEN... The ROAD SAINTS, MOTORCYCLES SPANNING THE STREET, ARE HEA RIGHT FOR HIM... Off Louis, his confusion and dawning fear... Cut to, EXT. VENTURA BOULEVARD - OUT OF THE SCHOOLBUS... Out steps Hayley, safe into Maggie's arms. Sitter looks o Maggie hugs her... WHILE... INT. MICK'S HOUSE - MICK LIES ON THE FLOOR... Where he was shot. He's alert but still...
Then rouses more as he HEARS feet come up the front steps WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forces out the words) They're down! I'm shot! Suddenly LANKFORD & SOBEL are through the door-- Lank sees Mary on the floor, while-- SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, Haller-- She rushes to him. Lankford's already on his phone-- LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lankford, we've got a shooting, twelve-twelve Creek off Laurel, we need paramedics, ambulance transport for two-- During which he's checking Mary Windsor's body, revises-- LANKFORD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transport for one. Rings off. Sobel takes Mick's hand, presses it to his wou SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press hard and keep pressing. Mick's hand is on a blood-soaked hole, hurting like hell. while Lankford makes another call... LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's Lankford again. Tell them it's over, they can grab Roulet and bring him in... He what? (LISTENS-- SURPRISED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, bring him to the Emergency Room first, then bring him in! (rings off; to Sobel) Dig this. The uniforms had some help picking up Roulet. Some motorcycle gang was already beating the shit out of him. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figures it out--) The police were tailing him?
SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She levels.) We thought he'd come after you. We couldn't tell you. The truth is we had plenty on him for killing Renteria. Jesus Martinez will be released. But we wanted Roulet for Levin, too. I told you: We had to find out how he beat the trace. Now we know. (her glance goes to Mary WINDSOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was almost perfect. He's still wearing the anklet... MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... SOBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it puts him half a city away. Just like last time. They share a look at the cleverness of it. When-- LANKFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Mick looks, HIS WOOZY POV AGAIN: Lankford, wearing a glov lifts Mary's gun. Pearl-handled: The WOODSMAN. Admiring-- LANKFORD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't make'm like this anymore. Mick, makes a shape with his free hand. The "Longhorns" s inner fingers pointing down. Like Raul made. MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "W." Mrs. Windsor. Which is the last thing he manages to say before blanking FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN, EXT. HAYLEY, CLIMBING A TREE
dialogues.text: L.A.'s best weather: Smog-blue. The tree off Mick's porch Hayley's skinny legs climb nimbly from branch to branch. From the angle, we can tell someone is watching her. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifts herself. Nimble. And so pretty. Watching is:

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Recovering, but not fully there. MAGGIE SITS INTO FRAME beside him. MAGGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were awake. He looks at her. Questioning. MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we haven't been living here. We did, for a while. When you were touch and go. Mick. Returns his gaze to-- HAYLEY, going branch to branc MAGGIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better get her down, she can get hurt up there-- MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get hurt anywhere. Let her climb. An almost normal tone of voice. She smiles. CUT TO,

dialogues.speaker: RAP BLASTING, EARL AT THE WHEEL...
dialogues.text: MICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your speed up, Earl... He's IN THE BACK-SEAT, IT'S A MESS... He's scribbling on papers as they ride... His CELL-PHONE RINGS... MICK (CONT'D) (INTO CELL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Haller. CUT TO BLACK.
